author: {'steamid': '76561197987565903', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1710588922}
review:
Chronology is a nice little puzzle platformer.

Puzzles focus on time travel between two 'states' and stopping time entirely. You control two characters: the old inventor (you) and a snail that helps you on your way.

It's a pretty small game. Can be finished in about two hours. Light puzzle elements, not too hard on the platforming either.

Was ok.

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1657066208}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260350560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1703413645}
review:
2/5
This game is a puzzle platformer that was really lost when it came to the platforming part. None of the puzzles were particularly difficult but I found myself hating the controls in general. The brightest part of this game is surprisingly the companion you meet half-way through the first level. The gimmick of traveling through time would get old if it wasn't executed so seamlessly but I still found the idea to get a bit samey. On the other hand I really did like the ability to stop time. It actually made me stop and think through a few of the puzzles. All in all, I can't recommend this game entirely because of the clunky stilted platforming. It feels like your jumping while slightly stuck to the floor. It's not bad for 3 bucks but I don't know if I'd pay 5 bucks for it personally.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253040073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1698384381}
review:
Teaboy's Basic(ish) Reviews....I read a lot of reviews when looking at games on Steam, and it quickly gets tiring â€“ those who write involved, down to the micron scale reviews, although helpful, end up like looking at War & Peace when youâ€™ve only got time for a quick 5 minute dump!  This is middle of the road and to the point â€“ not easy for me as I tend towards sesquipedalian loquaciousness!  Vociferously Verbose?  Alright, verbal diarrhoea.  (Although I hate panning a developerâ€™s work and all the time, effort and love they put into designing these â€“ it is their life after all â€“ this is my honest, personal opinion of my level of enjoyment.  Sorry devs!).  

A note on time played:  My Steam clock does not seem to work properly, indeed, it even minuses time on occasion!  Plus, I have a tendency to wander off and leave games running at times, so time played may not be entirely accurate!  


Teaboyâ€™s Tonsil Titillators or Toenail Titbits!  (Rating)  

Tonsil Tickler (Totally Tops):  The frenchy of which you always dreamt!  To quote a master, â€œSheâ€™s got a tongue like an electric eel and she likes the taste of a Manâ€™s tonsils!â€.  An absolute masterpiece and joy to play.  

The Tits (Terrific):  Everyone loves playing with these!  Not THE best bit, but such fun on their own you can be lost for hours....mmmm.  What most games you really like score â€“ perfection is so rare after all.   

Torso Teaser (Taker of your Time):  Itâ€™s a flat stomach....sure itâ€™s nice to look at, run your fingers over, slobber on a bit, sometimes that bellybutton gets your motor running....but it's just basically the corridor between the two â€˜gaming roomsâ€™.  The definitive â€˜Mehâ€™ - the middle â€˜sideways thumbâ€™ option for which everyone on Steam cries.  

Todger/Tadger & (scroTum) Taters (Tedious):  Is it an â€˜aâ€™ or is it an â€˜oâ€™?  Who cares!  The meat can be fun to play with for about 5 minutes of your entire day, the rest it just hangs there and generally gets in the way of doing something else.  The main problem of course, is the two veg sticking to your inside thigh.  This is what this game feels like â€“ the occasional/rare bouts of fun, the rest bobbing like a 19th century British Policeman (now you know why!).  

Toenail Tornado (Total Toss):  A playthrough so appalling itâ€™s like being trapped in a Turkish sauna with the ugliest, hairiest, fattest, sweatiest beast of a neolithic hominid whoâ€™s trimming his toenails using pliers and the splinters are reminiscent of a scene from the Normandy Landings.  My god how did this get released!?  


Teaboy Touts (Score):  Torso Teaser


The Review:  

It's simple but ok to pass a few hours.  Not a ringing endorsement I know, but if you want something stress free that requires just a half-dozing brain then this will do.  

Your sciencey-boffin type has the ability to change time from the past where everything works to the future (now) when everything is fubar.  He can also jump and go through doors to other levels/platforms.  Your snail sticks to walls and can be used as a platform in itself, and can also freeze time.  You can call the snail to you and it teleports itself by your side.  

This is it in a nutshell.  A puzzle platformer that isn't too challenging and something to waste a few hours on (super short but super cheap) that will you feeling, "Eh, I've wasted time on worse."  On Steam, that's in the plus section!

author: {'steamid': '76561199551563409', 'num_games_owned': 27, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1699913260}
review:
Chronology es un juego de plataformas, puzles y aventura que nos invita a viajar en el tiempo y a manipular el pasado y el futuro para resolver el presente. El juego nos pone en la piel de un Viejo Inventor y su fiel compaÃ±ero, un Caracol que puede detener el tiempo. Juntos, tendrÃ¡n que explorar un mundo lleno de misterios, secretos y peligros, usando sus habilidades especiales para superar los obstÃ¡culos y los enemigos.

El juego se divide en ocho capÃ­tulos, cada uno con su propia ambientaciÃ³n, mecÃ¡nicas y desafÃ­os. El juego combina la acciÃ³n, la exploraciÃ³n y el ingenio, haciendo que el jugador tenga que pensar en cÃ³mo usar el tiempo a su favor. Por ejemplo, podremos cambiar entre el pasado y el futuro para modificar el entorno, crear plataformas, activar interruptores, etc. TambiÃ©n podremos detener el tiempo para congelar objetos en movimiento, escapar de las trampas o atacar a los enemigos.

El juego tiene un estilo grÃ¡fico muy bonito y colorido, con un diseÃ±o de personajes y escenarios muy original y detallado. La mÃºsica y los efectos de sonido tambiÃ©n acompaÃ±an muy bien a la atmÃ³sfera del juego, creando una sensaciÃ³n de inmersiÃ³n y aventura. El juego estÃ¡ disponible en varios idiomas, incluyendo el espaÃ±ol, tanto en los textos como en las voces.

Chronology es un juego muy recomendable para los amantes de los juegos de plataformas, puzles y aventura, que quieran disfrutar de una historia interesante, unos personajes carismÃ¡ticos y unos escenarios variados y sorprendentes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006640610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1696105978}
review: It's a cute puzzle platformer where you play as an old man on a steampunk set world. He awokens in near future when the world has more or less ended. He finds a clock device that he can switch between two time-periods, before and after the big disaster. To his help he has a giant snail that he can use for the different puzzles. There is a story put in between these puzzles that makes it charming. The puzzles could be at times really difficult, but the artwork and overall game seems to be fitting for kids at the age of 7 and perhaps above. It took me about 3 hours to complete (with some help with a walkthrough on 3 areas).

review: Questo gioco ha delle buone idee che secondo me sono state poco sviluppate. L'unica cosa che un po' mi Ã¨ piaciuta Ã¨ lo stile grafico disegnato a mano anche se gli scenari sono molto simili tra di loro e di conseguenza sembra di ripetere sempre lo stesso livello. author: {'steamid': '76561198200827945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1638263758}
review:
Chronology is a game I've been following ever since I saw it on Greenlight, and I'm very glad it got its chance to be released. The game is very imaginative, and the way you progress and use the mechanics make for a really fun experience. I also really like the voice acting, the design of the world is very pretty, and the music and sound is absolutely phenomenal. The game has a pretty good sense of humor, and I really enjoyed the exchanges between characters. The game's length isn't the longest you can find, but it feels right for the kind of game it is, and more than makes up for it with content. You will not regret picking this game up.

Overall, I give this game 88/100, and would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes puzzle games, or likes the use of time manipulation in a game.

review:
Its atmosphere is awesome. I'm fascinated by this interaction between the past and the present. 
Some of the puzzles are cool, a few have some cruelty :(
I like the idea of this story, but It isn't detailed enough and it seems insufficiently disclosed.
The final scene should have been longer and more difficult.
Yeah, you can find bugs in the game. But in my experience they were not critical, but rather strange and funny. 
In spite of the disadvantages, I recommend you to play Chronology

author: {'steamid': '76561198053531044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1680324133}
review:
While not utterly devoid of charm (which is probably obvious if you're reading this while thinking about whether or not to purchase the game from the lovely artistic aesthetic and decently-made trailer), Chronology has a surprising number of problems that aren't apparent until you actually begin playing the game. They aren't even neatly grouped into a single category or area; there are a lot of small problems that invade what could have been a pleasant little puzzle platformer and leave it feeling anemic.

-There is about a third of a second delay every time you jump or fall from any height. While not long enough to actually be irritating, it is mildly annoying and feels out of place. It hurts to say this about something that I know required extra effort to animate, but the reality of the situation is that I feel like this adds no additional value to the game and only serves to make every instance of vertical movement just a bit less pleasant.

-The story makes absolutely no sense, but lacks any aspects of satire, lampoon, or comedy. It's implied that we should be taking the apocalypse seriously, but there simply aren't enough details given about the characters or setting to grow any real attachment to them. You don't necessarily [i]need[/i] a long game to grow attached to characters or develop a poignant relationship, but Chronology has no idea what it's doing. One character tries to imply that another is "running away from their past," but they've literally done nothing but face their problems head-on the entire time. It has a simplicity that makes it feel like it was made for children under the misguided assumption that everyone under the age of fifteen is an idiot, yet also incorporates elements of amoral PC adventure game nonsense, like breaking child's leg to create a nonsensical solution to a puzzle.

-The puzzles themselves are "fine" but ultimately uninspired or completely nonsensical. The game has neat concepts, with the idea of two different characters who both have unique time-related abilities, but from start to finish it never feels like anything especially novel occurs with these wondrous abilities.

If you want a time-themed puzzle platformer, play Braid instead if you haven't. If you've already played Braid, just look for a better game. I don't have any particularly strong negative feelings about my time with Chronology, but it truly left me with nothing special or unique for my time. At its core, this game lacks both heart and substance, which feels surprising and almost deceptive for a game with such charming art.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971838196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1673749370}
review:
Spielwertung: 6.5/10
Spielzeit: ca. 2.5 Stunden
SpieldurchlÃ¤ufe: 1 (Ende)

Leichtgewichtiger Plattformer/Puzzler mit dezentem Frustfaktor

Hatte das Spiel vor zig Jahren mal ne Stunde zum Idlen laufen gelassen, um die Karten zu farmen. Jetzt habe ich das Spielen nachgeholt. Ergebnis: Wie so viele "kleine Spiele": HÃ¼bsch, originell mit vielen SchwÃ¤chen.

Mein Hauptkritikpunkt: Die Steuerung ist im Grunde nur fÃ¼r Controller optimiert. Wie man Maus und Tastatur-SpielerInnen so dreist links liegen lassen kann, erstaunt mich immer wieder. Das ist ja kein 0815-RPG-Maker Spiel, sondern ein von westlichen Entwicklern gemachtes "Eigenwerk". Das Aufzwingen von Pfeiltasten Ã¼ber WASD, die komplette Nicht-MÃ¶glichkeit eigener Belegungen gibt automatisch saftige AbzÃ¼ge. Ich habe mir sogar ernsthaft Ã¼berlegt das Spiel sofort wieder zu deinstallieren, nachdem die Steuerung nur mit den Pfeiltasten ging. Es ist einfach unangenehm, teilweise sogar krampfhaft schmerzend. Nur die Aussicht, dass es sich um ein "kurzes", eher "einfaches" Spiel handeln sollte, hat es mich durchziehen lassen.

Die "RÃ¤tsel" sind ok. Ein paar Stellen sind schon echt mies, so dass man locker wie ein Idiot 20 Minuten an derselben Stelle steht (ansonsten wÃ¼rde man das Spiel wahrscheinlich richtig schnell durchziehen).

Die Ladezeiten sind ne Katastrophe. Ernsthaft. Das Spiel ist uralt, mein Rechner kann modernere Sachen gut laden und so ein "mini"-Game spielt 10 Sekunden Cinematic und danach 1 Minute Ladezeit? Und das immer und immer wieder? Also irgendwas passt da nicht. Immerhin gab es keine AbstÃ¼rze.

Das Spiel "bestraft" zurÃ¼ckgehen radikal. Falls man irgendwo nicht weiterkommt und dann weiter hinten sucht und wieder zurÃ¼ckkehren will, wird das unmÃ¶glich gemacht (z.B. bei der Stelle mit der Kanone). Ein "Tod" in die Tiefe lÃ¤sst dich nicht am "weitesten" Punkt respawnen, sondern an Ort und Stelle. Einzige LÃ¶sung: Das gesamte Kapitel von vorne. 

Die Story ist ohne viel Tiefgang, aber wird mit Charme und schÃ¶nen Zeichnungen der Comiccharakter erzÃ¤hlt. Man hat eine oberflÃ¤chliche emotionale Bindung. Aber: An einer Stelle wird es extrem unmoralisch. Ohne zu Spoilern sage ich nur "Kind" + "Banane". Von der ganzen Aufmachung richtet sich Chronology ja eher an jÃ¼ngere Zielgruppen, da fand ich so eine zynische Nutzung deiner Kraft schon echt Ã¼bel...

Das Ende kommt dann auch sehr Knall auf Fall, aber immerhin rundet das Game mit einer kurzen Schlussabspannsequenz ab, anstatt einfach plump zu enden.

Fazit: Ganz ehrlich: Das Spiel hat mich nicht abgeholt. Ich hatte mir mehr, etwas "runderes" erwartet. Trotzdem ist die Idee mit den Zeitzonen, dem Schneckenbuddy und der hÃ¼bschen Graphik schÃ¶n umgesetzt. Man sollte sich bewusst sein, dass der Umfang des Spiels 1-3 Stunden betrÃ¤gt und keinen Wiederspielwert hat, da es nichts zum sammeln oder irgendwelche Geheimdinge gibt (was dem Spiel an sich guttut, aber es hÃ¤tte sicher doppelt so lange sein kÃ¶nnen, um sich dennoch vollwertig anzufÃ¼hlen).

author: {'steamid': '76561198046595924', 'num_games_owned': 4780, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1671595572}
review:
My Chronology Video Review is available here:
https://youtu.be/WeQQ6dKEaF4

Is a game content based on time manipulation and switching two environments interesting enough to make a good puzzle platformer that could be enjoyed by both children and their parents? Letâ€™s start with the pluses - good story that is developed further, original game concept, two charismatic main heroes with time based special abilities, sense of humor, well designed puzzles, difficulty suitable for casual players, beautiful game graphics, good music and great voice acting. The game is not flawless of course, so here are the minuses - quite a short length, snailâ€™s ability to stop time is not sufficiently used, sometimes clunky controls and low number of music tracks. The game with two main heroes would deserve some form of a local multiplayer so, itâ€™s a pity that it is not present here.

Pros:
- story
- original concept
- two charismatic heroes
- sense of humor
- puzzle design
- difficulty for casual players
- graphics
- music
- voice acting

Cons:
- short length
- snail's ability is not sufficiently used
- clunky controls sometimes
- only a few music tracks
- no local multiplayer


The gameâ€™s target group are mainly children or casual players due to the game's relaxing fairy tale-like atmosphere, short levels and easy difficulty. I could imagine that the local co-op and the game design that would be using the characters' cooperation more often would make the game great for family playing. Like this it is still a very good puzzle platformer that most casual players will have fun with and thus I am giving Chronology Thumbs Up and Video Gaming Fatherâ€™s Index 8- out of 10 - recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025321433', 'num_games_owned': 1160, 'num_reviews': 452, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1670188664}
review:
Chronology misses the mark by a mile. While the developers clearly tried to make a fun and simple puzzle platformer, the game is sadly just not that fun to play. The story is unfulfilling, the controls are clunky, the time travel gimmick is not really used to its full potential, stopping time (the snail ability) is only used very rarely and can mostly be ignored and the puzzles range from really easy to nonsensical. 

Some of the puzzles feel only solvable if you do something that seems to be completely unintended, unfitting or weird and while it seems obvious in hindsight, it isn't at all obvious while you're playing. For how simple the game is, the puzzles should have been thought out more. One puzzle in particular near the end made my jaw drop to the ground because the solution is so nonsensical and out-of-character for the main characters that it felt the developers just gave up at that point.

The biggest problem though, despite the extremely short length (about 90 minutes even if you get stuck a bit), are the bugs. I experienced no less than a dozen. You can phase into the ground by time traveling "into" NPCs; jumps sometimes do not work; I have fallen through the snail shell several times; a puzzle just would not work for me despite following the walkthrough to a T because I felt I was going crazy, until it then decided to randomly work after all without me changing anything; the characters get stuck in animations sometimes, and so on.

Figment, by the same developers, embodies that very same design philosophy of Chronology, but is a trillion times more polished and thought out. I chalk this game up to the developers still finding their groove. I can see the intent is there, but the execution is flawed and haphazard. I would skip this game and support the developers by checking out Figment instead, which is similar in terms of being a simple, pretty puzzler (though isometric), but is actually fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198871993191', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1669027987}
review: A word of caution..... It is a fairly simple game. The good thing is that its relaxed atmosphere is perfect to playthrough in an afternoon. Only a few of the puzzles were tiresome to figure out so the game is accessible to many ages. I liked the adorable artwork and animations.  Time stopping gameplay is easy to grasp. If you like puzzle platformers, it's a decent one. Might be in your best interest to get the game on sale since its short. Quaint and brief. Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198422199704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 431, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1664722052}
review:
Though most of the games i tried from this company has many flaws, may it be the mobile version or the pc port version... this one here is a nice game with everything done right except the key mapping... (keyboard player beware, this is tuned for right handed players only on the keyboard and you can't change it, best play it on controller if you are a left handed player)

The story telling is nice, the music matches the game's atmosphere and the puzzle though not hard are fun to solve. Wish all their games have this quality... this one here is a job well done!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044621170', 'num_games_owned': 766, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1658269505}
review:
I was close to recommending this game despite it's flaws as I don't like downvoting a game by a small team, and there are a couple of good things there, but the flaws are just dreadful, the graphics are really nice and sweet, the actual gameplay has some nice ideas and it's short and well valued at Â£3.99 for it's length and that end credits song was damn good. 

But there were some things that really, really let it down, 1 the characters/voice acting. The old man is a jerk, to the NPC's and the snail for literally no reason and he's the one we are meant to be rooting for. That said the snail has the most annoying, grating voice, that whenever it speaks you want to punch it in the face.

The ideas for gameplay, stopping time, jumping between timezones are nice, but they don't do anything imaginitive with them, the puzzles are relatively simple and samey then you get one which is non-sensical, so you can't help but get bored, the story doesn't help - I mean it's not objectionable but it's once again not really imaginitive. The controls at time were also painful (I used controller) it wasn't very intuitive.

It's a shame because there are good ideas in here, but they just never did anything exciting with it, and all you'll want to do is kill the main characters off constantly. (which I did briefly with the old man and had to restart the level)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045648963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1648423125}
review:
This game has a nice premise, but it's awful compared to it's time travel puzzle games that preceded it. It's you and a snail and more than one of the puzzles is confusing, in other parts of the game things you did earlier for some reason don't work anymore, and in OTHER parts of the game you can do the RIGHT thing and it doesn't always trigger right. Also the graphics can be a big "jaggy" where it blurs the screen, coding error? Not sure, but it can get weird. You can also easily softlock in SO many places. This game feels like they did a test run of it and the main dudes like "ok its done good enough. two hours of content. It's a wrap! Wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

TLDR: Terrible time travel puzzle game with a great premise but falls short comparative to other games of the niche. Not much of a story, and then the game just abruptly ends like it had this big long story... silly game.

review: Game is fun. Have it on iOS and I like it. Unfortunately, on PC, the game is bugged. I am stuck at the part where I meet the snail and I can't give its shells, because the plant that is supposed to grow in time and let me go to where the snail is, is not growing. Developer isn't responding either and hasn't for a very long time on the forums. Guess they forgot about the game... too bad! Can't recommend the game in its current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205774116', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1643406435}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090082186', 'num_games_owned': 2294, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1642002297}
review:
Chronology is a 2d platformer with simple time manipulation. You're as an old inventor with your friend Snail, travel among ruins of civilization after (and before) the technological disaster.

I'd wish to call this game a good and short journey for children, for example. But because of puzzles which have no logic, I'll not to do it. Awful riddles as if came from point and click from 2000s. I'll describe one moment: you have to buy the ticket to the elevator, but the cashier speaks on the phone, and she doesn't even notice us. Soâ€¦ [spoiler] We need to stand up on a snail shell in the past, jump on the wardrobe, cut off the flower there, then plant the flower in the pot. After we have to stand up again on platform near the first flower position and jump aside. While jump, we must change timeline and try to grab the wire of ceiling light in the present. Then use this wire on the plant in present, take its tooth and with this tooth cut the phone wire outside. After that we need to cut off this flower again in the past and give it to cashier in present.  [/spoiler] And only after this we'll get the ticket to ride. As you see, everything is intuitive and understandable. We will encounter such moments two or three times. Instead of simple go through guards as we have time-stopping abilities.

Low-resolutioned textures doesn't look good on the full screen.

The biggest part of my walkthrough time I wasted looking for answers of another mad riddle. 
Chronology doesn't fell like the whole standalone game. Don't recommend it to anybody. 2d-platformer lovers or puzzle-solvers easily will find something better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260279870', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1640822194}
review:
Cute game with some interesting puzzles.  As mentioned elsewhere has time travelling feature which is also in some other games (my personal fav The Silent Age) but I don't think that matters.

Shortish but I can't remember what I paid for it so maybe the price justified the gameplay time.

Found a bug very early on where a mechanism did not work but a restart overcame it, and a couple of places where I got stuck in a space but time shifting usually fixed it.  And a "feature" (not going to format as a spoiler because there wouldn't be much point) once at the cannon DO NOT GO BACK past saw!  This is possible but you are then stuck there and have to restart chapter if you exit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287195129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1650090667}
review: I got this on sale for the price of a mall gumball, which honestly is a complete steal because this game is actually quite fun. much better than a mall gumball.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025070619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1640088803}
review:
Short but enjoyable puzzle platformer. Recently I happened to play "The great perhaps" which has exactly the same mechanics as Chronology. Puzzles are solved utilizing both past and present timelines by using some time traveling device.

However, Chronology executes everything better: more agile controls, clearer puzzles,interesting characters and most important of all: action is packed into tight 3 hours without bs.

author: {'steamid': '76561199114428408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1637242074}
review:
Chronology is a casual puzzle platformer that makes for a perfect relaxing evening. 

Pros:
+ The art and the sound are wonderful. I especially liked the different portrayals of the same areas as they change through time.
+ The puzzles are fairly easy but quite fun and well-integrated into the environment, though a few towards the final chapters were a bit tricky.
+ The game does not punish you if you fail as the inventor respawns immediately and doesn't lose progress in the chapter.

Cons:
- I loved the story and the presentation in the beginning, but some elements felt rushed. I found the friendship between the inventor and the snail rather unconvincing and the snail character itself not compelling.
- The ending of the game was quite underwhelming, but that didn't take away from the fun in the chapters before,
- There are some minor bugs but nothing that majorly impacts gameplay.

6 languages to choose. (german,english,russian,italiano,espanol,Portuguese).
a good options menu.
playable with keyboard or controller.
music and sound are very good.
price is in offer very good.
all in one 5/10

review: This game is honestly awesome. Too many stuff happening. Time travelling, magic snails... I don't even know. Best thing ever

author: {'steamid': '76561198011845242', 'num_games_owned': 3499, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1628260460}
review:
Chronology is a 2D Puzzle Platformer where you play as the Inventor who uses his watch to switch between 'Before' and 'After' states. By switching between these states, items and certain platforms can become available, and they make up much of the platforming and puzzle aspects of the game.
You will eventually meet the Snail which can act as an additional platform from which you can use to jump from to reach certain locations along with its own unique time ability.

The game isn't very long and while a few puzzles were a little tricky to figure out, it's an overall solid game and I quite enjoyed it. Visuals and music are nice as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170255631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1627727598}
review: Fun little puzzle platformer. You and your friend snail must save the world in this nice looking game. You travel back and forth trough time to move forward in game, snail also stops time, little bit of jumping and than you think some. Game is cheap and short. You get entertained for few hours and move on. For the puzzle platformer fans.

review: Decent game. Short, fun. Very very cheesy dialog; if you don't want to see an engineer and a snail snarking back and forth at each other with bad puns, don't play this game. The ending was a bit anticlimactic, but overall, a game I enjoyed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124526537', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1624819170}
review: My only problem si the loading scenes take like five minutes and one time it crashed. Otherwise cute game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198127051617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1624699010}
review: Good quick game.  The puzzles weren't overly hard but they did need a bit of out of the box thinking and playing around with all of the different "features" within  the game (time travel, the snail etc).  I finished it in less than a day but I appreciate that it didn't need a huge time commitment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015003424', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1624212101}
review: Chronology boasts some pretty, if somewhat childish, visuals, but fails to differentiate itself from other time-manipulation platformers that came before and that had more soul. Clumsy controls, cheesy narration, and boring puzzles just make it feel clunky.

author: {'steamid': '76561199073620839', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1670011371}
review:
Es uno de los juegos mÃ¡s agradables que te podrÃ¡s encontrar en estos lares de Steam. Muy bueno para pasar el par de horas, con una jugabilidad e historia bastantes interesantes y poco comunes. 

Creo que se le pudo haber sacado mÃ¡s al concepto que envuelve a este titulo, pero con lo que me da es suficiente. OjalÃ¡ haya algÃºn otro proyecto relacionado con este mundo que  nos comparte Chronology.

review: It was a cute little adventure of a gnome. Took about an hour and a half to complete (had to replay one of the chapters cause I was curious if I could softlock myself and well I could). The puzzles are more relaxed and nothing too complicated. The environment looks great but one thing that left me bamboozled is that the gnome refers to the snail as her but to summon it he yells here boy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198797989609', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1622236689}
review: You play as an Old Man and a Snail, solving platforming puzzles. The Old Man can jump, and shift between the present and the future, as well as summon the Snail to his location. The Snail can climb on surfaces and freeze time. The variety and creativity of the puzzles you need to get through is all very impressive, and it's fun solving them. I was wary of this game because of how many mediocre review scores it seems to have, but it's a solid game. Super short, but it goes on sale for 90% off all the time so just pick it up when it's cheap and you'll get your money's worth.

Developers, fix your shit yo!

review:
Juego de plataformas en el que encarnamos a un inventor capaz de hacer avanzar o retroceder el tiempo. Ello harÃ¡ enfrentarnos a cÃ³mo seguir avanzando.

[h1][u]PROS[/u][/h1]

Buena mÃºsica ambiental que no se hace nada pesada.

Efectos de sonido muy buenos, como el de la lluvia.

GrÃ¡ficos buenos para el tipo de juego que es.

Te narra una pequeÃ±a historia. Y los personajes (el inventor y el caracol) van hablando entre ellos.

[h1][u]CONTRAS[/u][/h1]

Ninguno en particular salvo que es algo corto.

[h1][u]CONCLUSIÃ“N[/u][/h1]

Buen juego para comprar con rebaja.
TendrÃ¡s algunas horas entretenidas.
AsÃ­ que lo marcarÃ© con el pulgar hacia arriba.

[h1][u]RECOMENDACIONES[/u][/h1]

Como siempre, recomiendo ir haciendo copias entre sesiones de juego del directorio de saves.

[u]Linux[/u]
<Steam-folder>/steamapps/common/Chronology/RFSaveData*.rfo

[u]Windows[/u]
<ruta-al-juego>\RFSaveData*.rfo

author: {'steamid': '76561197967362446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1619524210}
review:
Took me more time to get this to run on Linux than actually playing (Proton 5.0 + Protontricks) and also had to set a custom button layout for controller support.

The game has a cool combination of mechanics from Braid and Limbo along with a nice art style, but other than that the story was not that amazing and the final 'boss' was very anti climatic.

Full playtrough takes about 2-3 hours, depending on how much you crash/soft lock the game.

review:
Chronology (2014)

As the name suggest this game involves something to do with time. You play as a gnome who needs to travel to the past and future to restore the present. You have a trusty snail partner to help you in your time quest. Beautiful graphics and an easy to play puzzle-platform adventure game.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199097889427', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1610086701}
review:
In a nutshell, you have the ability to time-travel and stop/pause time to go through the puzzles, and you can switch between two characters while at it. The story is also interesting enough to keep you going.

It also has a nice soundtrack and beautiful animations. It is quite challenging and the controls may not be as tight and precise like other platformers, but given that it is an indie title and is fairly priced, I think it's well worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996273719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 798, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1610473738}
review:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

Chronology is an adventure platformer developed by Bedtime Digital Games.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

Brief memory loss is generally a popular narrative medium and the nameless protagonist of Chronology suffers from it at the beginning. Fortunately, memories quickly return and the little gnome realizes that civilization was almost entirely wiped out by one of his inventions, which was abused by his old mentor. But since, as a researcher of the world, he has a time machine with him, this is actually not as unbelievably tragic as you first suspect. He quickly makes it his goal to save the world as it should be for a decent hero. The only problem is that he has woken up in the middle of the wilderness and has to overcome numerous dangers before he can get to the capital and thus to his invention.

Unfortunately, the story doesn't tear up trees and prefers to rely on solidity, which is not improved by the rather mediocre speakers. Fortunately, the gameplay is more convincing. Because the little guy can travel around in time, some interesting puzzles and situations arise. Do you have to aim high in the present? Then just travel into the past and plant a flower there that will later sprout gigantic blossoms. That would have been an example of the simple puzzles at the beginning of the Odyssey, but a few more elements are added later - one of them not only likes to babble, but also likes to slime around in the truest sense of the word.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ Cool hero duo
+ Interesting game with past and future
+ nice puzzles
+ catchy soundtrack
+ Beautiful and coherent art style
+ Trading cards

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- short playing time
- Control not implemented well
- kept too simple

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Chronology offers you a good look and some really good puzzles that really demand all the skills you have learned.


[h1] Information / Review Deutsch [/h1]

Chronology ist ein Abenteuer-Plattformer, welcher von Bedtime Digital Games entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay / Geschichte [/h1]

Kurzzeitiger GedÃ¤chtnisverlust ist generell ein beliebtes ErzÃ¤hlungsmittel und auch der namenlose Protagonist von Chronology leidet zu Beginn darunter. GlÃ¼cklicherweise kehren die Erinnerungen jedoch schnell wieder zurÃ¼ck und dem kleinen Gnom wird klar, dass die Zivilisation durch eine seiner Erfindungen, die von seinem alten Mentor missbraucht wurde, beinahe gÃ¤nzlich ausgelÃ¶scht wurde. Da er aber als Forscher von Welt eine Zeitmaschine dabei hat, ist das eigentlich gar nicht so unglaublich tragisch, wie man zuerst vermutet. Schnell macht er es sich so zum Ziel die Welt zu erretten, wie es sich eben fÃ¼r einen anstÃ¤ndigen Helden gehÃ¶rt. Problematisch ist dabei nur, dass er mitten in der Wildnis aufgewacht ist und er zahlreiche Gefahren Ã¼berwinden muss, bis er in die Hauptstadt und damit zu seiner Erfindung gelangen kann.

Die Story reiÃŸt leider keine BÃ¤ume aus und verlÃ¤sst sich lieber auf Solides, was durch die eher mittelmÃ¤ÃŸigen Sprecher auch nicht besser wird. Zum GlÃ¼ck kann das Gameplay dagegen mehr Ã¼berzeugen. Dadurch, dass der kleine Kerl in der Zeit umher reisen kann, entstehen einige interessante RÃ¤tsel und Situationen. MÃ¼sst ihr in der Gegenwart hoch hinaus? Dann reist doch einfach in die Vergangenheit und pflanzt dort eine Blume ein, die spÃ¤ter gigantische BlÃ¼ten sprieÃŸen lÃ¤sst. Das wÃ¤re nun ein Beispiel fÃ¼r die simplen RÃ¤tsel zu Beginn der Odyssee gewesen, doch spÃ¤ter kommen noch einige weitere Elemente hinzu â€“ eines davon plappert nicht nur gerne, sondern schleimt im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes auch gerne mal rum.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ Cooles Heldenduo
+ Interessantes Spiel mit Vergangenheit und Zukunft
+ nette RÃ¤tsel
+ eingÃ¤ngiger Soundtrack
+ SchÃ¶ner und stimmiger Artstil
+ Trading Cards

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- kurze Spielzeit
- Steuerung nicht gut umgesetzt
- zu einfach gehalten

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Chronology bietet dir eine gelungene Optik und einige wirklich gute RÃ¤tseln, die einem wirklich alle erlernten FÃ¤higkeiten abverlangen.

review: Jeu dÃ©couvert sur mobile en ayant juste fait la partie dÃ©mo... achetÃ© sur PC suite Ã  une promo... l'histoire est trÃ¨s sympathique. Peut-Ãªtre pas assez longue et un peu simple. mais bien pour passer le temps tranquillement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120727795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1610237311}
review:
This *could be* a really nice game. But there are two things bothering me: 

First of all, the game is really buggy. By accident I managed to get myself into several situations that I found no way out again other than to close the game and start again from the beginning of the chapter. And again. And again. 
- Once, I tried to do a jump from snail's back that resulted in endless spawning and immediately dying because of falling down which made the whole game window flicker like it was on drugs. 
- Another time, I did an unlucky jump on a cannon ball and ended up caged between the structures where there was no way out again.
- And I also ended up on places with my snail where I couldn't get out again.
- Also, there's no option to just normally end and quit the game. One has to close the game using the windows task bar....
In my opinion, these things should not happen... and at least not so many of them.
Second, I found the old man not very sympathetic. I did not like the way he talked to the snail and also I was sorry for what happened to the boy.

I really enjoyed the different layers of time and switching between the characters. 

If I could rate this game by stars, I would give 3.5/5 stars by now. Since that's not possible on Steam and I think that something should be done to fix the bugs I experienced I cannot recommend this game. 
If there were no bugs, the game would get 4,5/5 stars from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006517107', 'num_games_owned': 1790, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1609750411}
review: Super laid back platformer with decently challenging puzzles. Great music, scenery, and storyline. Overall, I had a blast playing it despite the game ending somewhat abruptly. Well worth the money and I highly recommend the buy if you are looking for an amazing 2 hour experience or a fun game to entertain your kid!

author: {'steamid': '76561198312152072', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1609770852}
review:
A neat concept with a meh execution. You travel back and forth through time to solve puzzles. The story is simple and predictable but does its job. The platforming is not great, but functions.
Im not bothered by the simplicity of the game, im bothered by the characters not having likeable personalities. It's this "snail is an annoying young brad and old man is cynical old man"-dynamic, but not in a way that makes either character fun. Honoustly I'd have preferred if they had just removed the dialogue completely, it doesn't make me care for the characters anyways. 
I got it on sale for 50 cents, I'd say that for that money you could enjoy your 2 hours of gameplay, but I refuse to believe that there aren't any games out there that do this same mechanic but better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135169456', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1609561826}
review:
One hell of a game! Do you remember Braid where you could turn back time instantly? This game is quite similar.

It's fun to switch back and forth between the past and present in order to solve various puzzles. The puzzles were quite innovative and there's a slight linguistic humor.

Overall it was a pretty fun, memorable experience, although a short game that I finished in one sitting.

review: Love the art style and music plus the interesting and challenging puzzles. Thanks, devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092344121', 'num_games_owned': 1789, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1590988979}
review: It's okay for what it is when you get it on sale. And what is it? It honestly feels like a prototype for a game. It's very short. You can't interact with any of the buildings, and there are only a few difficult obstacles per level. The main character should haven't gained abilities as he progressed besides the snail. It could have been so much better than it was. The whole time I played it, I hoped for a finished version. The gameplay is unique and creative and worth a play if you like puzzle platformers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262565647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1605625925}
review: Half decent puzzle platformer. It goaded me to play to the end. But, not in a "holy jebes I just learned a new powerful spell" kind of way, more a "well, now that's done" kind of way. Liked the physical interactions of the characters, but not so their convos. Yick! The professor's personality needed its farks kicked. And the poormouth snail...well it was a poormouth...Anyway, I came for the puzzles which will tickle your brain a bit, but not muddle you. Overall, 6.5/10. Wouldn't buy it a second time...I'm recommending for the puzzles and platforming.

author: {'steamid': '76561199074746823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1599899356}
review:
This game is a MUST HAVE. The characters are adorable and funny. The art is beautiful and the music well chosen. The platform and puzzles solving are really cool, though mostly simple enough so if you look for a challenge this is not your game. Gameplay is more than ok. When in offer the prize is ridiculous so BUY this little jewel and enjoy it as much as me. For me the length was too short though. 

Juego para todas las edades (dificultad baja). Precioso artisticamente. Con jugabilidad buena, aunque mejorable. El sistema de resolver los puzles es muy original y simpÃ¡tico. En oferta tiene un preciÃ³ de risa, asÃ­ que vale la pena. Es un juego corto pero me ha parecido maravilloso.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996824666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1596685251}
review:
Not a bad game! It's very short, but the mechanics are pretty awesome and worthwhile. It's a clever platformer with some really cool puzzles and mechanics. I'd recommend trying to figure things out for yourself, but if you get really stuck there's some good walkthrough videos online.

This is the perfect game if you're combing through the hundreds of games in your Steam library and aren't sure what to play. You can knock it out in an afternoon and enjoy yourself doing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199069979075', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1595699601}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 809, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1595521097}
review:
Chronology is a puzzle platformer, where you play with time, alternating between the past and present to stop the Verve. The objective is simple, stop your Mentor before he destroys the world.

Gameplay-wise, best with controller. You alternate between the past and present using O. Along the way, you will magically chance upon a snail companion 

The Snail can stick to surfaces and is immune to all damage. It also has the power to stop time.

Conclusion,

author: {'steamid': '76561197972311940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1594840215}
review: Chronology is a short but sweet platformer with a fun, unique twist. With beautifully drawn backgrounds and creatures to back it up, this game is well worth the couple of dollars. The puzzles start out pretty straightforward, but get increasingly difficult toward the end. I had to look up the solutions of couple of times, admittedly. You're looking at about 2 hours of gameplay in one run, so it makes a perfect time-killer when you want something that doesn't involve too much mental investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048902826', 'num_games_owned': 1426, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1594502398}
review: Chronology is a cute, short puzzle platformer about an old man, a talking snail, and their time manipulation powers. The snail and the old man have different powers, such as the snail freezing time and the old man traveling between past and future, and the game uses these different powers to clever effect in creating the puzzles. Don't expect a grand epic or anything, it's quite short, but it's fun while it lasts. I was pleasantly surprised that the characters are all voice acted, not something I expect from an indie platformer. If you like Amanita Design's games or Braid, you should check out Chronology.

review:
This is a fun, no-pressure, thinking gamer's platforming game.  You get to play a time-bending artificer with an animal side-kick in a side scrolling puzzle game with notes of a visual novel.
Great game, albeit short.  I only wish it had trophies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035182410', 'num_games_owned': 1144, 'num_reviews': 372, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1588322103}
review:
Would be a great game if the last level didn't just abandon the timetravel mechanics completely and made you do timed jumping puzzles to ramp up the challenge. Also the game is a little short with only 2 hours of gameplay. But the 2 time zones you can travel between and the time stop make for a enjoyable little game. 

P.S.: The voice of the snail is really annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408768447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1589407006}
review:
Chronology is a short but sweet and fun puzzle platformer with really nice graphics. Takes between 2 and 3 hours to complete, with only a couple of puzzles towards the end becoming more complicated and requiring deeper thinking. The main game mechanic is that you can swap between 'past' and 'present', with things you do in the 'past' having effects in the 'present'. None of the solutions to the puzzles are too farfetched or annoyingly convoluted.
The game is recommended for those of you looking for some casual puzzle solving with mild platforming challenges added to the mix in a beautiful colorful world with funny loveable characters. Main criticisms of the game would be its rather short length and lack of a real mental challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059825119', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1589396228}
review:
Frankly, I expected more from this game, having previously read the very positive steam reviews. 
I liked the concept of solving puzzles by time traveling, which changes the environment around you. 
But, I didn't find the game quite fun. It gets kinda boring quickly, and when you lose concentration, you get frustrated by a few puzzles which are far fetched. They can be solved only in 1 specific way. 
I presume it helps to play this game not at once, but bit by bit, over a few days. 
I liked the hand drawn graphics. 
It is too short and it lacks variety and content. 
If you want to buy, do that only when on sale.

review:
Giochino simpatico che merita.
A prezzo pieno offre davvero poco, ma se lo trovate con un forte sconto, allora vi saprÃ  piacevolmente intrattenere per un paio d'ore.

VOTO: 6

----------
GRAFICA
----------
Graficamente cartoonesco, con tratti puliti.

--------
AUDIO
--------
L'audio niente di straordinario.
Sottotitoli in italiano.

-------------
GAMEPLAY
-------------
Rompicapo ambientale con un pÃ² di platforming, basato sul mandare avanti e indietro il tempo a due ere prefisse, oppure nel congelare l'istante. Non Ã¨ difficile, anzi, perÃ² gli enigmi sono davvero ben studiati,
occorre concatenare le abilitÃ  dei due protagonisti e utilizzare anche l'ambiente circostante.

----------
STORIA
----------
Molto semplice, Ã¨ facile con poche parole spoilerare tutto il gioco, per cui vi lascio la scoperta, tanto dura davvero poco.

---------
DURATA
---------
Il piÃ¹ grosso inconveniente Ã¨ che dura poco (circa 2 ore).

-----------------------------
PROBLEMI TECNICI / BUG
-----------------------------
Ogni volta che si avvia il gioco Ã¨ sempre in finestra, occorre andare in impostazioni e reimpostare a fullscreen (2 volte).
Personalmente mi ha dato noie nel riconoscere il controller XBox360, per risolvere ho creato un nuovo profilo dispositivo nelle opzioni di Steam e poi funzionava.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122112683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1582461204}
review: A charming and entertaining game, interesting puzzles, bright colours, great characters and voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191149025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1585230936}
review: It's a cute little game with nice graphics. There isn't much of a story there, the puzzles are mostly simple and you can finish the game in about 2 hours. There are annoying bits (the tooth plant puzzle, the jumping sequences with the saws) that may make you a bit frustrated but overall it's a relaxing game worth the money. I encountered one problem while playing - the game 'froze' when I was switching between characters - I could switch back and forth between them, but couldn't move any of them. Luckily just restarting the game resolved it. I wish it was a bit longer.

review:
Interesante la mecanica de alternar entre presente y pasado, te da 2 escenarios en 1, muy util, lo mismo el uso de la mecanica del CARACOL, Muy buena, Me encanto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098055486', 'num_games_owned': 1103, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1582870998}
review: Chronology is a great little platformer puzzle game that is both challenging and a decent length. I really enjoyed the storyline. The characters were also really neat. I would have loved to understand a little more about the verve and the backstory. All in all I thoroughly enjoyed the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054547661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1580218484}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1579718426}
review:
Chronology is a family friendly 2D puzzle platformer game with a cartoony art style.   The game uses two reasonably well known platformer gimmicks, character swapping (each character has different abilities) and phasing (you switch between two different time periods which affects how the platforms and puzzle components are worked out). 

First up the artwork and storytelling here is charming and of good quality.   Unfortunately the game design and implementation doesn't keep up.  Controls are sluggish and unfun (yes, one of the characters is a snail, no it's not a deliberate pun).   You have to use the gimmicks constantly to progress inches at a time, this is painful and not at all fun for anyone.   On a technical basis, we have two big fails, fixed controls and fixed resolution (720p or 1080p), despite the fact the game was released when 4K monitors were readily available.  The developers haven't fixed that shortcoming despite keeping the game on Steam.   If the flaws with the game were fixed I could see it may warrant the $7.50 price tag, but they're not fixed so I can't recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014473461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1576453091}
review:
[h1]Criminally under-rated puzzle-platformer[/h1]
[list][*]Yes, it's short -- 8 levels, each with only a few central puzzles.
[*]Yes, you can't skip cut-scenes -- but they're only 30-45s at the start of each level. 
[*]Yes, the puzzles are sometimes a little tough -- but each one is quite different and unique. The puzzles are the main draw here.
[*]Yes, the platformer controls can get frustrating -- but there's only one all-platformer sequence, near the end, and you don't restart the whole level if you die.
[*]Yes, the story is a bit thin and trite -- but it's fine.[/list]
Overall, [i]Chronology[/i] is just quirky and fun in all the right/rare ways. It's not a [i]Braid[/i] knockoff, it's doing its own interesting thing, and it's damn good at it.

[quote]For more puzzle game reviews, news & everything puzzle-related, follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25928931-Puzzle-Lovers/]Puzzle Lovers[/url] & check out our [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/puzzlelovers]Steam group[/url].[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198099310591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1570077639}
review:
The present and the past has been... screwed up. You play as Old Inventor ( a kind of gnome thing) and as Snail, your side-kick and frenemy. While your power is over time, Snail controls the speed of time. Switching between the past and the present, and between slowed or normal time, you solve puzzles to progress through the 8 chapters. At the end you stop the mad guy, Mentor, from screwing everything up completely.

Chronology is relatively short. I left it paused for a few hours but could probably have completed the game in 2 hours or thereabouts. The puzzles are rather straightforward but there is still a sense of accomplishment once you pass each one - especially when you do it first time. The last chapter, with the banana, is a little confusing at first but jiggling time back and forth the path forward soon becomes apparent.

Chronology's charm is in its simplicity. Not a lot of puzzle platformers are just plain old simple fun these days. It doesn't take a puzzle genius to figure these puzzles out. The aim of Chronology seems to be not in having amazing powers of deduction but rather in just enjoying a story balanced against its gameplay.

I ran into [b]zero[/b] problems with lag or response between screen and keyboard. Zero issues with graphics. Zero bugs. My [i]only[/i] recommendation is that if you pick up an item - key, banana, bucket, flower, etc - don't drop it right on top of an interactable element like a power switch because, like with any game, if you put two interactable items on top of one another, one will override the other.

I very much so appreciated the auto-save - I could turn Chronology off at [i]any[/i] point and it would pick back up [i]exactly[/i] where I was - and, if/when you die, Old Inventor respawns very close to where you last were.

I definitely I got my moneys worth with Chronology - Under $10 for 2+ hours of entertainment is, imho, pretty darned good. And I'm always happy to pay full price for indie titles, keeps them mean big guys on their toes.

Chronology is developed by [url=https://store.steampowered.com/developer/bedtimedg] Bedtime Digital Games[/url], the same outfit that made [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/493540/Figment/?curator_clanid=33021788]Figment[/url] and [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/308040/Back_to_Bed/?curator_clanid=33021788]Back To Bed[/url]. Both of those are worth checking out. If you're interested in trying some of Bedtimes games out there's a free demo of Figment here on steam.

O tema principal Ã© viagem no tempo e deixa a mensagem que suas aÃ§Ãµes do passado afetam o futuro.Quem nunca ficou pensando como poderia ter evitado um erro do passado?

O ponto que chama atenÃ§Ã£o no jogo Ã© a mecÃ¢nica dos personagens. VocÃª pode alternar entre o velho e caramujo. O velho pode alternar entre o passado e futuro, jÃ¡ o caramujo pode parar o tempo. Dominar as mecÃ¢nicas Ã© fundamental para a progressÃ£o no jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198378822473', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1690930904}

author: {'steamid': '76561198208370897', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1566128749}
review:
[h1]Generally[/h1]

Chronology is a platform-adventure game about time travelling, Bedtime Digital Games studio is responsible for the production of this game. In the game we take on the role of an Old Inventor and a Snail.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

This is a platform game in which our goal is to control an old inventor who, due to his amnesia, landed in a world he knows well, but destroyed. At the beginning of the game he discovers that we can manipulate time with a found watch. It is this watch that will allow us to go through the next levels, of which there are 8 in total. The game mechanics are very simple and pleasant. 

[h1]Sound[/h1]

Soundtrack in the game is pleasant, depending on the situation, the music changes. Ambient sounds are also ok. Dubbing in the game is ok, but there is not much of it.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

The graphics are in fairy tale style and very pleasant. Although it is a low-budget game, it looks very good. 

[h1]Summary[/h1]

Chronology is certainly not a game that was on my list of games that I want to play. However, I can not say a bad word about this game. This is a really good game for a platformer, although the puzzles are too simple. In addition sometimes a character can juggle or behave strangely, but it is not an element that rejects this game.
[b]

âœ”ï¸Short
âœ”ï¸Pleasant graphics
âœ”ï¸Nice soundtrack

âŒToo simple puzzles

[i]Time of completion:  2-3 hours[/i]

[b][u]Rating: 6.5/10[/u][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198101035178', 'num_games_owned': 2348, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1564344196}
review:
I got the game for FREE, but I will be objective.

PROS:

- Interesting gameplay and unique, fun mechanics
- Very aesthetic art mixed with a bit of weird art
(both art styles mesh together well with the final product)
- Good music, ambient sounds, effects and soundtrack
- Good voice acting (not the best, but really good)
- Variation in that the game will go easy on you if you miss the goal by a bit
- Short and sweet
- Family friendly and okay for ALL audiences to enjoy
- Good jokes and mediocre puns that can make you chuckle

CONS:

- Bugs (there are bugs, probably related to the game engine or certain actions. Also seeing "R.I.P. jokingly being stated for one of the studios behind this games, means that the developers probably have no intention of fixing anything)
- The game is kinda orientated toward children and family playing together too much
- Really short - it took me exactly 6 hours and I don't rush games and try everything possible
(trying to find easter eggs, hidden areas and never looking for Internet hints)
- Price is a little bit much for the game's cons. 5 euros seem a bit high - get it on sale (even 40% OFF will do)

The pros outweigh the cons and I actually really enjoyed the game and geniuinely wanted to FINISH it, no matter how long it was.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219343843', 'num_games_owned': 16122, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1558363067}
review: A fun little puzzle platformer with nice art and voiceovers. It allows the player to shift between past and present versions of the same map, as well as a second controllable character later on, and utilizes this mechanic to clear obstacles, reach higher ledges, or find other means to advance. Some of the puzzles might stump you since the interactive pieces don't always stand out in any appreciable way, nor does the game hold your hand in teaching you what to expect. If you don't mind trial and error experimentation, then you'll probably enjoy Chronology. Can be completed in about 1-2 hours. Safe for young children, no mature content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176274221', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1557602064}
review: Sehr knuffiges Jump and Run, die Story ist sÃ¼ÃŸ, wenn jetzt auch nicht besonders tiefgrÃ¼ndig, und die Charaktere sind super gelungen, alles in allem ein super Spiel welches man problemlos an einen Abend durchspielen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042620952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1377, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1557423173}
review:
[h1] Genre [/h1] Ein 2D Puzzle Platformer mit Zeit Manipulation

[h1] Story [/h1] Ein Erfinder und sein Mentor haben ein Artefakt entdeckt/erfunden was in Falsche HÃ¤nde BÃ¶se Auswirkungen haben kÃ¶nnte. Der Mentor nahm das Artefakt an sich und wurde Wahnsinnig und die Welt stÃ¼rzte ins Chaos wÃ¤hrend der Erfinder einfach fort ging.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] Wir spielen den Erfinder der in die Vergangenheit zurÃ¼ck reisen mÃ¶chte um seinen Fehler zu korigieren. Bald trifft er auf eine Schnecke die ebenfalls Negative Erfahrungen mit dem Mentor erlebt hat und die beiden machen sich Gemeinsam auf den Weg den Mentor zu stoppen. Es gibt 8 Level/Kapitel in denen wir verschiedene RÃ¤tsel lÃ¶sen mÃ¼ssen. Wir kÃ¶nnen bzw. mÃ¼ssen hierbei von der Gegenwart in die Vergangenheit switchen oder die Zeit komplett anhalten um Puzzle zu lÃ¶sen. Oftmals mÃ¼ssen wir die FÃ¤higkeiten der Charaktere verbinden (Schnecke hÃ¤lt die Zeit an und Erfinder wechselt in die Vergangenheit um Ã¼ber Hindernisse zu kommen oder GegenstÃ¤nde aufzunehmen). Die RÃ¤tsel sind relativ einfach und schnell lÃ¶sbar. Die Animationen & die Musik sind dabei Hervorragend.

[h1] Pro/Contra [/h1]
+ HÃ¼bsche Grafik
+ Nettes Gameplay
+ Sehr Gute Musik (besonders die HauptmenÃ¼ Musik & der Song im Abspann sind Super)
+ Sehr Gute Animationen
+ Guter Sound
+ Story ganz OK
+ Nette RÃ¤tsel
+ XBox 360 Controller Support
+ Sammelkarten

- Leider keine Achievements

[h1] Fazit [/h1] Ein richtig HÃ¼bscher Netter Puzzle Platformer der sowohl fÃ¼r Erfahrene als auch fÃ¼r AnfÃ¤nger sehr geeignet ist. Die RÃ¤tsel sind relativ einfach aber gut. Eine ganz Klare Kaufempfehlung

author: {'steamid': '76561198111278439', 'num_games_owned': 831, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1557341839}
review:
This game has an interesting mechanic, which makes it fun to use. Although it loses the surprise factor quite rapidly. I also started to get a bit annoyed in chapter 4 when I had to restart the level 2 times due to 2 different bugs. One the abilities stopped working and the other the screen started flickering after my character died and it didn't respawn.
The ending seems very rushed and the story wasn't very engaging.
I liked the concept and it was fun at the start but that was it.
I think this could be a great hit if it was given more depth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167068829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1556976252}
review:
A fairly easy game, quick to learn and fun when you want some time well spent.

For all the puzzlers out there: No, it is not a diehard puzzle game. Just do it for the cute story and fun time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025586135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1556978451}
review:
Not a bad game so I will not give a negative rating
But I did find some things annoying about the game
- Controller and action response is a bit slow
- Changing response between times past and present & stopped and constant is a bit slow
- Not a game that can continue playing repeatedly 
- Sometimes you make a mistake and cannot revert it, like dropping a key next to cannonballs, and unable to pick it up again. So you have to restart the whole chapter... not that it is long but still
- I know it was short game but it is very short. Not even many cutscenes of his past

On that note, what was good
- The game is simple and you have to accept this 
- music was cute along with the graphic sprites which are ok
- the puzzles were not hard and not boring either, they allowed for a little challenge and good timing (better response from controller).
- like the option to bring objects from different times
- Animation is good

The story seems very similar to the Disney Up, on the note that you have to consider that the character is really dead and facing these adventures with his trusty snail that moves him along (for schmeckles) in the afterlife. 
Definitely a game for all ages. 
Although its a thumbs "UP" I would like to hope the developers would put more effort into future projects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170899273', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1557456216}
review:
Not really a platform gamer. actually haven't touched a controller since Super Nintendo. Don't really know how to use keyboard actions very well either....but this game is intriguing moving through time completing actions and some case having to synchronize it all. It is a doozy for me. I have to say this platform held my interest as much as any match 3 game does. 
Well worth checking it out

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1550797439}
review:
Tags: Platformer
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Short duration. Puzzles. Two protagonists. Levelswap from past to future. Uninteresting story. Gets annoying to manage the gimmicks.

Chronology is your typical indie puzzle platformer. Each act is rather short, but having to constantly level swap. As well as transition from the snail to the old man gets a bit tedious. Some of the solutions need some thinking while others have you trickjump across simple platforms. The short duration and forgettable setting makes this a prime candidate for archiving in hidden library. I am not exactly fond of puzzle platformers and there is little enjoyment or replay value left after getting through it once.

I would recommend checking out Gianna Sisters instead for a more action oriented take on a similar concept.
https://store.steampowered.com/app/223220/Giana_Sisters_Twisted_Dreams/

author: {'steamid': '76561198166076478', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1546723249}
review:
I'm only 20 minutes into this game but I have so far played about 6 or 7 minutes of gameplay. On my current low-end laptop (which can run The Witness, Hollow Knight, almost all 2D Indie game with ease), there are achingly long load times. Unfortunately these are also placed in between the short cutscenes, meaning you end up waiting through a long load time to see a 30 or 40 second cutscene, and then go back into a long load time.

This game is full of charm, and I will probably come back to it when I upgrade my machine. The small glimpse of the time-bending mechanic I have managed to see is well implemented, in terms of aesthetic and sound design, and I imagine the developers have done interesting things with it. Unfortunately, some of the game's sound effects are horribly compressed which really takes away from the great voice acting. The music seems well written, but the sound is unbalanced so it gets washed out by the crunchy sound effects.

So far, this game does a lot in the right direction: The mechanics seem well thought out, the writing and voice acting is solid and the main character seems charismatic. For every good thing, however, there seems to be a drawback that really does take away from the game experience as a whole. We'll have to see how it pans out when I get an upgrade but for now, it's a no from me =/

author: {'steamid': '76561198427374354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1545174418}
review:
A cute little platform puzzle game with a neat time manipulation mechanic, which allows you to switch between past and future, as well as freeze time. You play as two interchangeable characters, a wizard and a snail and the puzzles are mostly well done and fun, although a couple did stretch the gameâ€™s internal logic a bit, and were hard to figure out. Itâ€™s an entertaining and enjoyable game, though pretty short. It took me around 4 hours to complete.

I do have two gripes, though. Firstly, it lacks a save game feature, so if you have to quit the game for any reason (for example, as a result of the several progress breaking bugs I encountered) you have to restart the level, and secondly, it lacks a couch co-op option. With 2 characters at play, it really felt like this was  missing.

If you like the time manipulation bit, I recommend that you give the game ''Seasons After Fall'' a go. Itâ€™s got a similar mechanic and is an excellent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970941771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1540648420}
review: First impressions looks really nice. Only problem is the level loading times; I've never known anything so slow. Could probably go down the pub for a pint between level loading, which doesn't seem very good for a 2D platformer. I'll update after a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158747968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1536368006}
review: Clunky controls. These puzzles are either way too easy or they're the kind of puzzles where you have to do some crazy shit nobody could think of; either not challenging enough or have bs solutions. If you want to spend Â£4 on 1:30 of gameplay then go ahead (the game literally took me 1 hour 30 minutes to complete, no extras, secrets or anything). Just don't waste your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990455931', 'num_games_owned': 931, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1534798758}
review:
didnt much like the puzzle with the kid/old man as i repeatedly jumped into the hook it said his arms were too short to reach.
And for some reason the last bit of the game completely takes away the mechanics youve been using for the first 95% of the game and turns it into a standard platformer
[spoiler] game ended with saying the verve is done, despite it being clearly in view of the player [/spoiler]
over all a fairly decent game despite its issues that im clearly not the target audience for
