author: {'steamid': '76561198139779101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1534601627}
review:
Juego muy corto y con algo de moraleja. EstÃ¡ interesante por la narraciÃ³n y la mÃºsica, aunque ser tan corto no le permite tener mÃ¡s puzzles que revelar.

Tiene un pequeÃ±o inconveniente con algunos saltos que estÃ¡n muy justos y que el viejo puede quedarse atascado entre una pared y el caracol (pero se soluciona moviendo al caracol).

Es entretenido para una tarde aburrida y en periodo de oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097579386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1533510976}
review:
Nice little puzzle/platformer game that utilizes freezing time/time travel to manipulate your surroundings and solve puzzles.  Short game, 2 hours to beat - and that was basically playing chapter VII twice since progress is only saved upon completing a chapter.

Overall I would recommend this game, but not at full price - wait until it's 50% off or so.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991435580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1532319456}
review: Got it on sale for $1.25. For that price, it is worth it. A decent puzzle platformer. A playthrough can be finished in a single sitting. The "feel" of the jumping could have been finetuned a bit better, some puzzles in the 2nd last chapter are quite obtuse, and the ending is abrupt and underwhelming, but overall I enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085694933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1531344436}
review:
[h1]Se te queda la cara de tonto[/h1]

[i]Chronology[/i] es un juego de plataformas en 2D con puzles muy fÃ¡ciles de poquÃ­sima calidad. Esto va de pasear y mirar el bosque ya que ni las breves plataformas que encontrarÃ¡s son dignas de llamarse plataformas.
La historia no estÃ¡ bien desarrollada, solo hay una intro, un amago de algo y un final apresurado. Â¿DÃ³nde diantres estÃ¡ el nudo? Â¿CuÃ¡l es el conflicto?, Â¿cuÃ¡l es el motivo por el que uno de los personajes se vuelve tonto y villano? Â¿De dÃ³nde saliÃ³ ese caracol? Â¿QuiÃ©n diantres eres tÃº? Todo un sin sentido.

Las pocas ambientaciones que se nos presentan son tan bÃ¡sicas con una camiseta blanca en oferta del â€œPull&Bearâ€. Se nos brinda una mecÃ¡nica de adelantar y retroceder en el tiempo con un simple clic y asÃ­ aprovecharnos del entorno. Esto es la mayor baza del juego y la verdad no resulta demasiado interesante (no es una mecÃ¡nica nueva). Hay que alternar el tiempo para saltar sobre mecanismos y estructuras nuevas, o por el otro lado,  beneficiarse del paso de los aÃ±os y tener un escenario lleno de elementos deteriorados. AsÃ­ constantemente para sortear los obstÃ¡culos. 

El juego va dirigido a un pÃºblico infantil (con esa edad de ver Disney Channel y Boing) o especialmente a usuarios reciÃ©n llegados al mundo de los videojuegos. La facilidad y la brevedad del tÃ­tulo puede ser un insulto al jugador medio experimentado. 
Tras superar los 3 primeros niveles (son el tutorial), seguimos con 4 niveles mÃ¡s que son fÃ¡ciles y cortos (contamos ya con 7 niveles que han hecho la funciÃ³n de toma de contacto para aprender la mecÃ¡nica completamente). Cuanto todo parece que se pondrÃ¡ interesante llegamos al nivel 8 donde sin jugar mÃ¡s te dicen que es el fin. No hay enfrentamiento con el jefe final y la historia se cierra de un plumazo sin que des cuenta de que esto ya se acabÃ³.

La cara de bobo que se te queda es digna de un TV Show de cÃ¡mara oculta. PedÃ­ la devoluciÃ³n porque me parece caro por 3 niveles de un juego sin sentido. 

Buena idea para un juego que se queda muy muy lejos de merecer un aprobado. Mi opiniÃ³n serÃ­a totalmete distinta si existieran 10 niveles mÃ¡s en los que aprovechar el concepto jugable. Para algo parecido con viajes en el tiempo instantÃ¡neos deberÃ­as probar [i]Silent Age[/i]. Es una aventura grÃ¡fica con buena historia y mecÃ¡nica similar. Todo el juego se siente como un trabajo desmotivado y eso me pone triste.
  
[b]Lo mejor[/b]: la mecÃ¡nica de adelantar y retroceder en el tiempo para superar el nivel no es nueva pero es entretenida. La ambientaciÃ³n de los niveles de bosque con lluvia es agradable.
[b]Lo peor[/b]: la historia es chirriante y muy mala, existen anuncios de TV mÃ¡s largos, en realidad solo existen 3 niveles con consistencia. Algunos puzles con fallos que te harÃ¡n reiniciar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208078171', 'num_games_owned': 723, 'num_reviews': 553, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1531159347}
review:
First level was really boring. I just pressed B (controller) alot to swap behind the past and the present/future? and move a block or two, trick a guy, let something rust away or let the landscape slightly change for me to jump over to it.

Second level was the same, however it's looking like you will have to do the platforming parts mixed with the changing time parts, no big deal really.

But then, there you get the snail. Holy balls the snail's voice is the worst thing in the fucking world. It's so "I'm on a kids show at 7am with all this energy" type of voice. Just google it if you need to hear it to understand but it's bad.

I'm done with the game now because the platforming wasn't hard, the puzzles were way to straightforward, the art is mediocre and simple and the idea just feels like it was implemented way to clunkily for my taste. I understand I haven't played much but I don't really have anything in this game that's drawing me back. It's all so bland, minus the snail voice. That's pushing me away.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995261977', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1531074816}
review: While this game is short, it's fun to play.  It immediately makes use of the present-time/future-time switching aspect without almost as soon as you begin.  The puzzles are nice brain-teasers without being annoyingly complex.  The artwork is nicely done with a good mix of color palettes distinguishing the brighter, full-of-potential present-time and the darker, post-cataclysm future.  I highly recommend playing with a controller.  In my opinion, it's a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054524847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1528023180}
review: A very nicely crafted platformer with some good puzzles in it. It's a shorty, but a goody.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049271328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1527886545}
review:
[b]DISCLAIMER - Got this as part of a massive bundle so effectively did not pay full price[/b] 
Nice little puzzle platformer which may be a little too much on the short side - only took me 2 hours to complete it.
It had fun little mechanics, and a good mix of puzzling and platforming.
The story is very simple. It wasn't terrible, just don't expect Shakespeare or anything. The characters are fine, though a little two dimensional (pun intended). I do think the inventor you play as cripples a guy for life in the name of progressing to the next level though soo...
Anyway all in all it's a nice way to spend two hours. Possibly longer or shorter depending on your puzzle-platforming ability. I would recommend it because of that, but wait for a sale to buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040882512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1526586197}
review:
This was a weird game with terrible voice acting (think like, early-2000s jRPG dubs bad) aggressively boring puzzle design and a nonsense plot. Also the characters were just awful. Why was the old guy such a terrible person?? My favorite scene was where he realizes he needs the snail and then in the same cutscene where he calls it back is already telling it to go fuck itself again. The most absurd part is that instead of a final boss battle you platform to the final boss' location and somehow your platforming causes him to drop dead and the game's like, well, he's dead, and then it just ends. It was incredibly bizarre.

The central mechanic is that you have a phenomenally specific time machine that takes you back and forth between two exact moments in time and you can use the differences in the landscape over time to platform. In practice is was stupidly simple -- go back, move a block, go forward, jump on block, go back move forward, etc. There was never any point at which it wasn't immediately clear what needed to be done and what needed to be done was always insultingly simple. It was all the worst things about indie platformers: more attention paid to painting the background than to creating a coherent game, and acting as though its trite elements were somehow super clever.

Also, it somehow had longer loading times than Witcher 3, which is an absurd thing to have to say about a 2-hour platformer.

that voice acting tho

author: {'steamid': '76561198035452392', 'num_games_owned': 907, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1526916768}
review: Cool short game. Simple platforming and neat little puzzles. Challenging enough and not frustrating. Good option if you feel like playing something short and sweet. Art is really nice too but may get in the way since sometimes you think it's a platform or something. Good thing you spawn nearby. Pretty cool game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198370714154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1527446154}
review: Chronology is an interesting mix of ludic, puzzles whit time travel. I think itâ€™s important to emphasize the flaw of this game, maybe the only one that bothered me. Chronology show us the lore in a very captivating way, all itâ€™s relation with the time (not only in the story but also in the puzzles) gives the game a mysterious characteristic of a good storytelling. But this is not the flaw. With a story that hooks us in its beginning and puzzles following the same quality all we needed was charismatic characters. Well, Chronology also has it, not only the main character, but his partner (that sometimes took all the attention) Snail, the most cute thing in the game. Well, the artistic stuff then? No, this is not the flaw; the artistic work is very well done. The only flaw of Chronology is to have only 8 stages, making the game too short. With all those qualities itâ€™s natural that we would like to play more and more of Chronology.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165223256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1526096181}

author: {'steamid': '76561198174768571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1525132207}
review:
Chronology is a fun, short, puzzle platformer that incorporates time trival, which affects the environment arount you. The story is more of just an outline really, as you spend time switching between the two main characters. Each one has their own ability and you need to combine their skills, to complete each level.

I did have a couple of issues with the game. Firstly, as others have mentioned, it sometimes hangs loading the chapters, but simply pressing shift-tab to briefly bring up the steam overlay, fixed it. Secondly, I had some screen tearing. I enabled v-sync on my GPU, which only helped a little. It only bothered me because I was enjoying the look of the game so much.

Overall, I think the best part of the game is the art style and music. Difficulty is pretty low, but I did have a little trouble with one puzzle near the end. The voice acting is passable, if a little ropy at times. Recommended though, for a coulpe of hours of puzzling fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045984337', 'num_games_owned': 1085, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1529170970}
review:
I've play this game years ago when it was released on Windows Phone 8, it was free for first 3 chapters, but as we all know the Windows Phone is a buggy OS it often crashed at some part an can't even reach the 3rd chapter. Just recently I discover this game is on Steam, so I buy it right away.

This game feature time travel puzzle, so you need to turn the time back or to future or stop the time to complete certain tasks. The puzzle difficulty is quite good, and the length of the game is short, about 2 hours to complete the game. 
The graphic is good, the voice acting is good, but the background sound is a bit dull. The ending is somewhat anti-climatic too, I was expecting some puzzle platformer based battle with final boss, the Mentor, but at least it's not a cliffhanger.

For "how much I like this game score" I will give 3/5 (not bad)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972807050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1518896397}
review:
Entertaining and well designed 2D platformer even if relatively simple and a little annoying, but with ingenious technical twists revolving about the present and future states of the play zones.
The annoyment comes from some of the puzzles that are not really intuitive but they make sense once you figure them out.
The game will test your reflexes and your wits and the interaction variety is appreciable.

Relatively short but overall enjoyable and well made. Especially appreciable the fact that falling in pits or otherwise 'losing' doesn't punish you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113388537', 'num_games_owned': 4356, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1519385112}
review:
[quote]
[h1]An old mans tale[/h1]

He we got a nice and neat puzzle platformer with a rather short story.
This game is quite old and has been released a while back. But even then this game is playable and completable without a problem. 

I do like this game, i like the story, i like the characters and i like the world.
This game keeps a lot of things simple. You move with the arrow keys and controll and switch characters with wasd. Riddles arenÂ´t that hard and the feature of travel betweem feature and past is well made. Everything is rounded with a well drawn graphics. The most beatiful things is the soundtrack. So good i bought it on the devpage, sadly its not avaible here on steam. 
Despites the goods things there are few things notable.
Mayor problem is the budget. Why?
Well this game is short and can be played within half and a hour. Story is nice but not deep. Same applies for the characters. 
DonÂ´t get me wrong the combo between snail and old men is awesome and works well but afterwards you know nothing they are replacable. Not considering the main evil has no name except for the mentor, because he is/was his mentor.
Second thing were you see is how this game is made, how polished it is. Everything works with minor glitches but the flow needed  for a realy enjoyment is missing. The snail for example only looks in one direction no matter were it moves. 
Surely this is an indie title but this bugges me the most. An interuptes flow. I didnÂ´t feeled absorbed into the game.

I realy hope i can see a game with simerlar mechanic and more content from the same devs. I wouldnÂ´t mind building my own levels. 

If you are interested or got this game out of a bundle its good and a try worth. 
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198096114971', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1516330683}
review:
This game was good. I think the platforming was a bit hard. The level designs reminded me of those super mario maker levels people make where you have to jump perfectly right or you die. Really the art style and the platforming reminded me of the old school flash games.

The time travel idea was pretty good and the narration is pleasant. I only played chapter 1 before giving up on chapter 2 at the start of the level. I could not make it to the other platform. I got annoyed at the characters repeated HOOOOOOOOOOOoooooooo as he fell into the chasm. I know I could stick the jump eventually but I just did not feel like trying further when I have such a large back catalog of games to play and review. I am putting this in my "try later" pile. I feel like the price is good and kudos to the devs for including this in a charity bundle.

review:
Great game with awesome graphics. It has decent story considering the length of the game. I bought it on sale for 1.24â‚¬ and it was very worth it for that money. 

You combine the present and the past in this game from which you solve some good logical puzzles alongside with platforming part. You can also freeze the time with the snail in the past/present and that is very cool! :) 

Also, the sound in the game is kinda mystical which fits thematics perfectly and the narration(yes this game has narration xD!) is pretty good in my opinion.

I'd give this game rating of 9/10 because it's kinda short but everything else is great!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970859560', 'num_games_owned': 5618, 'num_reviews': 358, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1514947728}
review:
There was potential here that went unrealized. The graphics are decent, reminiscent of Aquaria, and the sound and music are fine. The voice-acting is okay.

The controls are sloppy, the puzzles simple and repetitive even for a short game, and the primary mechanics (the time freeze and time reversal) seem almost...unnecessary. Near the end, right when you should be challenged to demonstrate competency at the mechanics learned through the game, they are abandoned entirely and it becomes a cheap Super Mario 3 clone. I got stuck in walls and had to reload several times. The storyline is muddled, and the protagnist only has enough personality to be dislikable. Seriously, why is he mean to that snail for no reason?

Art, assets, idea, all good. They needed better writing and way better level design. In my opinion, the makers should've fielded this for free on Kongregate then used what they learned to tighten up the ideas and make a better game, if they're going to charge money for it.

*Edit: Also, the load times are pretty unacceptable for what this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076824543', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1515643516}
review:
I received this game from a friend.  So I gave it a try.  I had a feeling I would like it.  I was not wrong.  The game is delightful...while it lasts.  Although it is a puzzle-platformer, it has the feel of one of the old Lucasarts epics.  Yet its narrative ends so quickly that it perhaps can hardly be called an epic, even though it aspires to be.  Thankfully, there is no "fluff", but I couldn't help being disappointed, even though I received this as a gift.

I do recommend this game, but be forewarned that there is not much to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964345647', 'num_games_owned': 921, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1514671314}
review:
Art/Graphics: 4/5 (Beautiful world)
Immersion: 2/5  (Time spend idle takes you out of the game)
Gameplay: 2.5/5 (Basic)
Controls: 2/5 (Very clunky) 
Value: 3/5 (Inexpensive, but really felt like $1 value)  
Difficulty: 2/5 
--------------
Overall 2.7 (Difficulty always excluded)


Chronology is a puzzler platformer, which uses, rather than phase shift, a time shift mechanic (same difference really) to alter the world around you in order to traverse the world and progress.

I have to start by saying LOAD times are atrotious!!!  Half my paytime was loading each level.  There were numerous times I had to simply close the game and reopen to get the level loaded.

What about the good?  Well, it is beautifully designed, with pleasant voice over (though I feel like the writing targets children), but the character movements leaves a lot to be desired.  I suspect that the implementation flaws comes from the fact that it is a table port.

The game is very short, where you apply a number of mechanics to progress.  At some point a time stopping snail is introduced

Most of the puzzles are simple, but a few can be obscure [spoiler](in fact cruel)[/spoiler], but nothing that feels very satisfying.

I am definitely on the fence on this one, for $1 maybe yes, but because of the technical difficulties, I found it more tedious that enjoyable :(


ACHIEVEMENTS:  Sadly, none.


[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31208751/]Please follow my Pixel Art Curation to discover other great games...[/url]

NOTICE:  These are my opinions about the experience I had playing this game.  I share them in hopes that people who are like minded will either enjoy a suggested game, or avoid frustration wasting time and money on something I felt was a personal waste.  Please feel free to comment positively, but know that anything that trolls or is just simply negative comments will be quickly deleted.  The reality is, that my reviews are for people who do not own the game, not to initiate philosophical dialogue about it.  If you are passionate about this game, please feel free to share that in your own review.  

Funny nobody every trolls or bashes a positive review on steam ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1508744711}
review: Chronology is your typical indie puzzle platformer, if there's such a thing - surprisingly evolved in some aspects, and rather raw around the edges in others. On the one hand, visuals are charming, the music is very good and the puzzles are mostly neat - on the other, the story and the characters are paper thin, the controls are unresponsive and the platforming in general is pretty bad. Luckily, the focus is on the puzzles, so altogether Chronology leaves quite a good impression. Nothing sort of the brilliance of Braid, but a solid entertainment, if a bit short (1.5-2 hours).

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1612735002}
review:
Ein Spiel mit zwei Zeitebenen? Das klingt interessant. Ich wollte es nochmal spielen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1148844278
[b]Metropolis darf nicht untergehen - Geschichte[/b]

Metropolis, die wohl nicht zufÃ¤llig namensgleich zur Stadt Fritz Langs ist, ist vom Verfall bedroht. Wir spielen einen namenlosen alten Herrn, der dies zusammen mit einer sÃ¼ÃŸen Schnecke verhindern will, indem er den Verursacher des Problems sucht.

Wirklich verstanden habe ich die Geschichte nicht, vielleicht habe ich ein paar Informationen verpasst. Mir schien es aber auch eher nur AufhÃ¤nger zum Gameplay zu sein.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1148865099
[b]Zeit ist relativ - Gameplay[/b]

Um in den 8 Kapiteln des Spiels voran zu kommen, muss der Namenlose nicht nur genreÃ¼blich Ã¼ber Plattformen hÃ¼pfen und Gefahren ausweichen. Vielmehr muss er auch die Zeit manipulieren. Es gibt ein Jetzt (allerdings im Spiel als "Before" bezeichnet") und ein SpÃ¤ter ("After"), in dem die Welt leicht anders, verfallen, aussieht. Dies nutzt unser Mann ebenso, um Hindernisse zu Ã¼berwinden, wie die FÃ¤higkeit der Schnecke, die Umgebung zeitlich einzufrieren.

Da der Alte die Schnecke (fast) jederzeit zu sich rufen kann, ist es fÃ¼r den Spieler nur wichtig, den Knorz ins Ziel zu bringen. Dennoch sind beide Partner und aufeinander angewiesen.

Hinzu kommen ein paar GegenstÃ¤nde, die richtig eingesetzt werden mÃ¼ssen und fertig ist das Gameplay. Heraus kommt ein relativ kurzes Spiel, in dem man die verschiedenen MÃ¶glichkeiten eifrig nutzen muss, um dann aber meist zÃ¼gig voranzukommen.

Das ist auch gut so, da nur zu Beginn eines Kapitels gespeichert wird. Stirbt der alte Mann aber einen Bildschirmtod, so erscheint er in unmittelbarer NÃ¤he zum Weiterspielen.

Die Jump&Run-Einlagen sind so einfach, dass ich mich frage, weswegen sie Ã¼berhaupt drin sind.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1148845923
[b]Zeit fÃ¼r Micky Maus? - Technik[/b]

Die Grafik ist schÃ¶n gemacht, nur nicht ganz mein Geschmack. Gemalte Hintergrundbilder, von denen es immer je zwei (fÃ¼r beide Zeiten) gibt, schnuckelige Maschinen, eine dauergrinsende Schnecke mit Warnlampe fÃ¼rs RÃ¼ckwÃ¤rtsfahren, ein rauschebÃ¤rtiges Fez-tragendes MÃ¤nnchen. Eine Inspiration durch den japanischen Regisseur Hayao Miyazaki konnte ich nun nicht wiederfinden, die da sein soll, aber es hat schon einen sehr schÃ¶nen Stil, der nur manchmal ins kitschige abgleitet.

Der Sound ist gut, die Sprecher (Englisch) allerdings auch nichts besonderes, die Schnecke war mir leider zu piepsig. Dennoch immer noch OK. Es gibt auch deutsche Untertitel zu den englischen Sprechern der, wie es scheint, skandinavischen Produktion.

Die Handhabung mit Controller ist einfach. Tastatur (und Maus?) wurde von mir nicht getestet.

[b]Zeitliches[/b]

Ich habe fÃ¼r das erste Durchspielen 4h, beim zweiten Mal 2,5h gebraucht.

[code][b]In Zahlen fÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 7/10.[/b][/code]

Ein relativ kurzes und eher einfaches RÃ¤tselspiel in Jump&Run-Umgebung mit einer guten Idee bzgl. der Zeitmanipulation. Grafik und Sound wirkte auf mich aber etwas kitschig.

[hr][/hr]
[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. FÃ¼r meine Wertung zÃ¤hlt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abhÃ¤ngig davon, ob ich es einem Ã¤hnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067133364', 'num_games_owned': 1272, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1506296076}
review:
I suppose I have acquired this game as part of a bundle. The concept looked initriguing and I thought I'd give it a shot. I beat the game in 3 hours (and I could have managed it in far less). The art style is pretty neat (reminds me vaguely of Bastion for some reason) and the puzzles are for the most part - fun. The characters add an interesting dynamic to the game, however it would feel like the snail is merely there to assist the inventor rather than having any purpose of his own.

The story is limited and does very little to explain why things turned out the way they did, or how the snail got involved, or what their motive really was... At times the controls feel a bit clunky and unconfigurable. However, my biggest issue with the game is its loading time. It's incredibly terrible. I don't see why such a short game could manage such long and dragging loading screens, and why on earth would there be a loading screen to load a cutscene?

All in all, I enjoyed the game despite its flaws. I'm not entirely sure that would justify its price tag though. If you find it on sale it might be fun for the short while it lasts.

es entraÃ±able y al final se le coge algo de cariÃ±o a los personajes que usamos . Lo dicho, ideal sobre todo para los peques de la casa y para pasar un rato fuera de tantos disparos , LOL y todos estos juegos tan de moda.

En gros, toute modification dans le prÃ©sent aura un impact sur le futur. C'est trÃ¨s simple mais trÃ¨s bien fait. Audio anglais et STFR, la bande son est trÃ¨s zen. author: {'steamid': '76561198042327986', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1501280734}
review: A simple puzzle platformer that takes two hours or less to complete. While the majority of puzzles are intuitive, some are a bit off the wall, with almost no sensible answer. The story and art are a bit bland, but they run together well enough. The mechanic of going back and forth in time does allow for an interesting experience, seeing the interpretation of years without human intervention to nature. My biggest confusion is the giant snail. Did nothing else suffice for the puzzles that require something to be able to cling to a wall? Why can it talk and teleport? The snail just seems more out of place than most anything else in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018812372', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1502498261}
review:
+ Beautifully animated characters and great art. This is its strongest asset by far. The logo is BEAUTIFUL and is really Kingdom Hearts-reminiscent!

- The sounds sometimes clip out when changing between characters (at one point the music entirely stopped until I progressed, or the music was there but some sound effects were missing). There also just weren't [i]enough[/i] sounds. Like, when you first launch the game, you must first press the space bar to bring up the options on the title screen, and there isn't even a click sound for it. It's just awkward to have the music rolling, for you to smack the key, and then see the menu come down with no indicator.

- The keyboard controls are unchangeable. This is a major issue, because there is only a faint arrow that briefly shows for your control changing between the snail and the character, so switching can be so subtle that you're not sure that it even happened. And then each character's individual power is accessed by the same key, which just caused a great deal of confusion that could easily be solved by assigning each power a separate, dedicated key.

- The game opens with music whose tune's first notes are nearly identical to Hans Zimmer's Pirates of the Caribbean theme. I know it sucks that note patterns can become taken forever by a composer like that, but that's just how art is, so the composer really should have noticed that and written a more original melody. As it is, it just sounds cheesy.

- The Inventor calls the Snail with different lines like "Come on, boy," and "I'd better find another way to call her." Huh?

- The plot was entirely nonsensical. It didn't explain how the snail could talk, why it's so big, how it could [spoiler]teleport to the Inventor's location across the map at a whim (and it can't jump so you can't chalk that up to time travel/time-stopping)[/spoiler].

- The puzzles, while some were interesting requiring both simultaneous powers of the characters, were disconnected tasks, which is completely opposite to the "Limbo + Braid" comparison that one reviewer made. Each screen of each area was basically its own self-contained puzzle. Nearly an hour in to chapter VI (where I stopped), maybe one or two at most spanned more than a screen's worth (which was usually because of [spoiler]a doorway in a city area that you had to enter to reach a remote room for a brief moment[/spoiler]). Combined with the unrelatable plot, they were tiring to me, personally.

This is a good game for kids under age 11 or so, but not beyond that.

review: I tried this game twice and couldn't get into it. As a platformer, I didn't feel it succeeded...the characters just moved too slow for me. It felt a lot like a Flash game from the days of Macromedia. Interesting ideas, but ultimately not worth it to me. As someone else said, I personally don't like voting down games by smaller studios simply because the games they produce are often works of passion. This one just didn't work for me. Based on the majority of other reviews, though, it's very likely it will work for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997381526', 'num_games_owned': 922, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1497039829}
review: I'm always sorry to downvote games made by small studios of indie developers but I cannot really recommend this game. The overall production value is very low, the art seems great when you begin the game but later on it feels uninspired and cheap. The story is nonsense like the characters, there's no way you can feel any kind of empathy for them. The game itself doesn't really know what it is, is it puzzle or platform oriented? Some puzzles are quite clever but nothing you will write home about. The platforming parts are sparse and completely gratuituous. The only redeeming factor is that you can finish the game in about an hour, because more of it would have been unbearable. I wish the developer more luck (and budget) for their future games but don't waste your time and money on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049238784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1495552106}
review:
+ Charming. Nice tunes.
- Short. Lineair. Hardly challenging.

The changing between eras is really smooth, and the world is very charming, kind of Oddworld-like.
The excuse plot is paper, and the puzzles barely touch the possibilities offered by time travel. Some are "plant sapling, tree grows", sure, but most of them could simply have the two eras as "changing planes". The presentation is fine, but the main course is left wanting.
Got it on ridiculous sale, recommended for that price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070136255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1495322979}
review:
A unique "cute" game with a time control mechanic to solve interesting puzzles. The game mechanics are simple enough for casual players although the controls are surprisingly confusing and the game is quite short.

The game is great for what it was, only one or two obtuse puzzles unlike other puzzle games, and nice little story. I had my wife play it as she likes puzzle games and she described it having cute story and art . However, we beat it in under 2 hours and she is definitely not a speed runner so I'd definitely say the game felt a bit short. I would say this is may be for the better as the mechanics are simple enough the game would have eventually felt repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994471394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1495316575}
review:
Chronology

Pros:

* Beautiful soundtracks and scenery.
* Astounding time-traveling and time-freezing features to help you in your quest to solve puzzles.
* Relatively low price.
* A good 3-ish hours of gameplay.
* The snail is way too cute.
* Has trading cards.

Neutrals:

* Decent voice acting.
* Decent storyline.
Cons:

* No after game bonuses or content.
* No achievements available.
* Few characters.

Overall, Chronology is a relatively good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992180148', 'num_games_owned': 2514, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1493581935}
review: It took me 1.5-2 hours to finish, but I could have probably done it in one, so, sadly, it's really short. Still, I don't regret playing it.

Insomma, consigliato come tappabuchi se lo si trova sotto i 2 euro, data anche la sua scarsa longevitÃ  dato che lo si completa anche in meno di 2 ore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353816972', 'num_games_owned': 44, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1514595723}
review:
A fun and relatively short puzzle game.

Pros:

Pretty, fun, appropriate background music -- the only exception is the song during the end credits which is, quite frankly, awful. It doesn't fit the game at all.

It's fun to control both the old man and the snail.

Switching back and forth between the present and the future adds an extra element of thoughtfulness in regards to completing the puzzles.

The puzzles are somewhat complex, but not frustratingly so.

Cons:

The loading screen that occurs between each level takes 2-3 minutes to load. While this doesn't seem that bad, actually sitting through those 2-3 minutes multiple times becomes very tedious. It's not even that graphics-heavy of a game; I can't guess why these sort levels take so long to load.

The ending is very anticlimactic. In fact, the last level is the shortest one of all. SPOILERS AHEAD SPOILERS AHEAD And you don't even beat the mentor/boss yourself. The snail comes in and saves the day (by itself, not from you controlling it).

review: A really short game but totally recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198271621062', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1492342241}
review:
I got this game as a part of a Humble Bundle. The game looked enough like the sort of retro platformer I would like, and in that aspect, it did not at all disappoint. 

It is a short game and even if you are really slow in figuring out all puzzles (only two or three of which are really challenging) it would not last beyond 10 hours. 

I completed the game in a shade under 4hrs.

The only gripe I have with this game is that that there is no save in between the levels. If you exit the game somewhere in between, you will have to replay it from the last checkpoint. While it is not always a problem, some puzzles which require timing to see you through can pose problems if you have to redo them. 

Barring that one minor and entirely forgiveable flaw, I thoroughly enjoyed the game and how the time bending / stalling mechanics have been used to create puzzles.

The art is colourful, lively, and relaxing.

Is the game worth the asking price? Definitely!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041457591', 'num_games_owned': 1625, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1492437017}
review:
A reluctant thumbs up, mostly because of the low price tag.

I won't lie: the levels were pretty darn good: a 2-layered level design ('past' and 'future') where puzzle solving is central. When the snail comes in, you also get the ability to stop time. And those mechanics work well together (sort of like Lost vikings, but by far not as advanced). On top of that, it has beautiful graphics and sounds, so what more could you ask for...right?

Unfortunately, the game runs out of steam as it goes on. By the time you descend into metropolis, the puzzles lower in quality to an average point 'n click game, and almost suddenly it becomes nothing but basic platforming until the end. As said by others: it's short. That wouldn't be that bad (short games can be good too), but the storyline and boss battle seem to just be there because the developer ran out of money and/or ideas. Certainly compared to the intro, it's an anticlimax. :-(

Again: for five bucks, you can't expect miracles. And I certainly had fun with it. Just...know that the quality of the introduction won't last long...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960830998', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1485651017}
review:
Got this as part of HumbleBundle Christmas 2016, very low price. I'd recommend on sale, but not at full price. (unless its for kids!)

Needs a 50/50 rating on steam again for this one.

Puzzle platformer with novel ideas that don't really develop far enough. Great game for younger kids (13 and under) but a bit too easy for adults who've played the like before.

Pros:
1. Well presented, lovely colorful graphics and a good soundtrack
2. Nice use of features of time control etc
3. Feels good to play, really smooth controls

Cons
1. Too easy , only  a couple of puzzles gave a challenge
2. UNSKIPPABLE cutscenes. They aren't too long but I hate them
3. Not really developed as far as it could be, feels like a concept game - probably possible to finish in less than 2 hours.

5 out of 10 - If on sale its worth a pound or two, but you're looking at 2 hours and it's not always good to finish a game and wish it had more. This doesnt feel like it has quite enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025521262', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1483694389}
review: Pretty short, casual puzzle-platformer. With time control, of course, but that's nothing new. [i]Chronology[/i] oozes charm, from its quite pretty, hand drawn levels to its spritely music and just twee enough to be fun and not annoying voice acting. The writing is nothing to brag about, I even feel it misses a chance to pull a good timey wimey twist right near the end. Spoiler: [spoiler] Wouldn't it have been a gas if that kid whose leg you break turns out to be the Mentor/Villain from the future?[/spoiler] Where the game really shines is the individual mechanics of the two characters you play, (The Inventor and The Snail) who both control time in different ways. Going through the puzzles seeing the interesting ways their mechanics interact and fit perfectly into one another is what sells the game for me. Of course, being as short as it is, it feels like the game doesn't push that to its full potential. But definitely this game is worth picking up, especially if you like 2D platformers but can't keep up with the extreme difficulty that has become the fad with the revival of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045376199', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1483684146}
review: This game is a quick but clever little puzzle platformer.  I enjoyed how both the inventor and snail time mechanics played into each other.  It is a fun little game that is definitely worth a playthrough!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056049941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1483481964}
review:
Visually beautiful game. It is quite short. The story feels hacked together without that much thinking (e.g. I thought right until the end that the mysterious new Verve substance was ... a substance, not a living creature - not that it matters). I also didn't understand the need for the last puzzle involving another human - a small boy. It was completely unnecessarily cruel and I didn't see what the game, the story or even the game designers got out of putting that into the game - it's like a silly idea during brainstorming that should have been thrown out for a much better puzzle.

Overall I'd recommend it - it's a simple and enjoyable (and often hard enough) platformer with some puzzles. With graphics like these I expected more out of the other elements of the game I suppose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013834737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1483382392}
review:
Go into the game knowing that it is very short; you will likely finish in 1-2 hours even on a first playthrough. Also go into this game knowing that it is a mashup of all the classic gaming tropes: 

- Swapping Timelines
- Stopping Time
- Abusing Magic + Technology = Doomsday Scenario
- Former Mentor Turned Evil

Overall this game is nothing spectacular; it looks nice and plays well, but aside from a giant talking snail partner, it brings nothing new to the table. If you enjoy platforming and easy-moderate puzzles, this is a good way to spend a few hours.

It's executed very well for an indie game, but be warned there are a few game breaking oversights. Do NOT drop any item into water, there is no way to retrieve it and you will be forced to start the current chapter over again. Do NOT approach the end of chapter 7 while in the "After" timeline or you will be uable to progress and will be forced to start the chapter over again.

I would recommend this to puzzle/platform lovers when it is on sale, or when it is available as part of a bundle. I'd like to see a more polished, deeper gaming experience from this developer in the future, because the ideas are there, but they need some development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076061891', 'num_games_owned': 3109, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1516035436}
review:
This is a mediocre (bordering to awful) puzzle game, that looks great but have game breaking flaws and nothing special gameplaywise. There are one or two pretty clever puzzles in the game but apart from that the rest is pretty much just reusing the two most overused core mechanics from puzzle platformers (stop time and swap between worlds), and they have both been used in much better games before. The devs must also have realized that the snail would break some puzzle solutions and therefore they sometimes arbitrarly don't alow you to call her to you. 

It's also very short. I finished it at 1,8 hours acording to steam and it would have been shorter had it not been for the fact that you can permanently get stuck in a chapter and since there are no mid chapter checkpoints, you can have to replay the entire chapter again. I would guess you would finish it in about 90 minutes in a blind playthrough. Yes the chapters are very short but you shouldn't force the player to replay the entire chapter if they quit mid chapter (did this once) or if something with the game phyiscs breaks (this happend two times). But the worst of theese where when you give away your timeswapper just before the final confrontation (because reasons...) in the end of the 7th chapter, if you are in the wrong world (the current timeline) you are permanently stuck since you can't interact with anything and the platforms that you move forward with does not excist in this timeline. This is just incompetent game design, even for a 5â‚¬ game.

There are so many better games in this genre. Stay away from this tat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052378489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1482600462}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999509997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1482193819}
review:
This is a really nice game, it's currently (time of writing) on offer as part of a bundle for Â£3.01, it's worth it. The game is short around 3 hrs and I finished the game, take in to account I stopped halfway to make food/drink etc so this could easily be done in 2hrs. 

The game has a nice story, loved the main character but the snail got a little annoying. The puzzles are a bit on the easy side. The game uses a similar mechanic to Giana Sisters: Twisted Dreams, instead of swiching between dream worlds  you switch between the past and the present, you also have the ability to pause time.

My main gripe is that the game had a few bugs some objects would disappear when being carried, to get past the load screens I had to tab out and tab back in, dialogue would sometimes repeat.

If you can get passed the few gripes I have it's worth a try. I got this game as part of the jingle jam2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083490861', 'num_games_owned': 1461, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1482109641}
review: It's as timey wimey as it gets. My favorite part of this little game is when I break old geezer's leg in his childhood. Meh, he's a minor character anyway and sacrifice was needed in order to save the world. I can't help but compare Chronology to The Silent Age (another timey wimey game), and in my mind a game like that shouldn't be too easy like The Silent Age. Chronology has everything: good puzzles, rememberable characters, sacrfices, anti-hero and a deadbeat villain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067444037', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1484185601}
review:
I have so much love for this game and I've only played it for an hour or so! It has so many incredible mechanics, also I love time travel so this was right up my street! Chronology has an interesting plot and generally pretty good voice acting too. I'd heartily recommend this game to anyone unsure. I got the game as part of the Jingle Jam by donating (https://www.humblebundle.com/yogscast-jingle-jam).

I've decided to do a pull playthrough of this amazing game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GXGwFAqNFzM&list=PLySWle9ZKHFhWj6O1PfH3hapblV1e7MlI&index=20

Je l'ai refait plusieurs fois dans l'espoir de dÃ©couvrir des secrets et peut-Ãªtre des fins alternatives mais le jeu est dÃ©sespÃ©rement vide de contenu autant que d'intÃ©rÃªt. author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1473105951}
review:
[i][b]Chronology[/b][/i] est un puzzle-game Ã  mi-chemin entre les manipulations temporelles de [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/26800/][i][b]Braid[/b][/i][/url] et l'ambiance un poil steampunk de [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/249590/][i][b]Teslagrad[/b][/i][/url]. Oui, bon... je le reconnais volontiers... j'ai eu la main [strike]assez[/strike] trÃ¨s lourde sur la comparaison. En rÃ©alitÃ©, il ne joue clairement pas dans la mÃªme catÃ©gorie, la faute Ã  un manque cruel d'ambition.
 
L'histoire est plutÃ´t rudimentaire, rien que de trÃ¨s classique pour ce genre de jeu. En gros, vous devez sauver le monde. Pour cela, vous disposez de deux aptitudes : arrÃªter le temps (et donc tout ce qui se trouve en mouvement) ou bien naviguer entre deux Ã©poques (avant et aprÃ¨s, que sÃ©pare un certain nombre d'annÃ©es, avec toutes les rÃ©percussions qu'on imagine).

Techniquement, ce n'est pas toujours trÃ¨s... propre, en particulier au niveau des sauts. MalgrÃ© tout, le graphisme est agrÃ©able, la difficultÃ© trÃ¨s abordable (deux ou trois Ã©nigmes mises Ã  part, et encore) et donc la durÃ©e de vie pour le moins courte. A peu de choses prÃ¨s, comptez deux heures pour le boucler. Pour sa dÃ©fense, il affiche un prix des plus honnÃªte.

Bref, [i][b]Chronology[/b][/i] est un puzzle-game sympathique, mais hÃ©las sans grande prÃ©tention.

[h1]Verdict : 3/5 - Ce qui est assez bien, mais pas top.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198058895396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1472940072}
review: I don't write reviews quite often but I need to write some of my remarks on why I abandon playing this game for this game lacks common sense. -Spoiler warning- I liked the first parts, cool graphics etc. But when I reach to the city, it was a terrible experience, I thought old whimsical adventure games came back to haunt me again. The part that you want to get a ticket to ride the elevator is a complete bullcrap. This game is a good example of needing talent to create story driven puzzle games. Nonsensical puzzles are far more frustrating that any bugs you can encounter within any game. Anyway I am going to give this a thumbs up but not that I liked the game but for the efforts they put into creating it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044953811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1467802158}
review:
[h1]VerÃ¤ndere die Zukunft![/h1]

Chronology ist ein knuffiges kleines Game, das wirklich zu empfehlen ist.
Als alter Mann macht man sich auf den Weg, seinen Meister davor aufzuhalten eine ganze Stadt auszurotten.
Auf diesem "epischem" Abenteuer, begleitet Euch eine kleine Schnecke, die ebenfalls aus dieser Stadt kam.
DarÃ¼ber ist der alte Mann zwar nicht sonderlich erfreut, da die Schnecke zwar nervig fÃ¼r den alten Herrn ist, aber auch nÃ¼tzlich.
Gelingt es Euch also, den Ablauf der Zeit zu verÃ¤ndern?

[h1]Positive Aspekte:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Nette Grafik.
[*]SchÃ¶ne Musik die sehr gut zum Spiel dazu passt.
[*]Steam-Sammelkarten.
[*]Das Spiel hat zwar volle ControllerunterstÃ¼tzung, ist aber auch genauso gut auf der Tastatur spielbar.
[*]SchÃ¶ne Screenshotvorlagen.
[/list]

Das war es eigentlich schon im groÃŸen und ganzen... 
Diese wenigen positiven Aspekte sollen aber nicht zeigen, dass das Spiel schlecht ist, im Gegenteil.

[h1]Die negativen Aspekte wÃ¤ren:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Kurze Spielzeit.(Je nach Spieler positiver/neutraler Aspekt, mich hat's nicht gestÃ¶rt.)
[*]Keine Errungenschaften.(Siehe oben, kommt ebenfalls auf den Spieler drauf an.)
[*]Recht "hoher" Kaufpreis fÃ¼r max. 2 Stunden Spielzeit.
[*]Kein Wiederspielwert.
[/list]

[b]Mit anderen Worten, stÃ¶ren wÃ¼rde mich eigentlich nur der Kaufpreis.
Mir hat das Spiel echt gut gefallen und ich hatte es auch nach knapp 2 Stunden durch, die restliche Zeit die gerade oben drauf kommt, entsteht nur noch wegen den Kartenfunden. :)
Sollte das Spiel also mal im Sale sein fÃ¼r ca. 0,99ct oder gar billiger, wÃ¼rde ich es auf jedenfall empfehlen, sofern Euch das Genre gefÃ¤llt.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067382995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1466687095}
review:
As much as I liked this game, I have to say I am really disappointed by its length. Took me 2 hours to finish it and that's pretty much all there is to it, as there's no replayability whatsoever.

Also, one of the puzzles requires you to cripple a kid/man for life. I know that this is a video game and the characters are fictional, but seriously? That's pretty mean for a protagonist who's trying to save the world from destruction, if you asked me.

Still, Chronology is a solid and colorful platformer with a clever use of the time traveling concept. While controlling the snail, you can also stop time, but I honestly feel it's not used much throughout the game.

I will recommend this game, but I'm not sure about its price tag. It's not that 4,99â‚¬ is a lot of money; it's just that I've played many similar puzzle/platformer games with the same price tag that took me a lot longer to finish. Maybe get it while on a discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022458781', 'num_games_owned': 2808, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1464122036}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40165899]Curatore in lingua italiana[/url]

Il difetto di questo gioco Ã¨ la sua brevitÃ : a tal riguardo colgo l'occasione per osservare che quando ha introdotto la rimborsabilitÃ  dei suoi giochi, Steam non ha considerato che esistono giochi che si finiscono prima delle famose due ore dopo le quali si elargiscono le carte. Uno di questi Ã¨ Chronology. Detto questo, il resto delle caratteristiche del gioco sono in massima parte positive. Chronology Ã¨ un gioco di puzzle/piattaforme dai bei fondali, con una dinamica di gioco stimolante, e un duo di personaggi che per quel poco che si gioca riescono a essere vivi divertendoci. La colonna sonora dei titoli di coda Ã¨ notevole. Consigliato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096178450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1463079776}
review:
Being a lover of Platformers, Time Travel, and Indie games, I knew that I had to pick this one up when I finally discovered it.
It's a simple platform game but the puzzles involved make very challenging at times.
I have to say what I loved the most about this game was the art. I found it beautiful and I loved how detailed everything is for a 2d game. The soundtrack was a nice background to the whole game. I really liked the song they used during the credits. I think the only downside to this game is how short it is. I would have loved to continue playing, I had a lot of fun and there were quite a few chuckles to be had over the commentary between the two characters. 
All in all it's a decent price but if you can get it on sale like I did, then it is a game I highly recommend you pick up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012061392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1462114110}
review:
If you are looking for a quick, short, fun, clever puzzle/platformer, this might be for you. This game took me about 3 hours to complete. I was already at Chapter 4 (out of 8) 45 minutes in.

Pros:
- Beautiful art
- I really like the protagonist's voice
- Snail mechanics

For 5 bucks.... boy, I don't know. I'd say it's worth it. This isn't a MUST PLAY game, but if you're looking for a quick puzzle/platformer, I think this is perfect.
3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197976999134', 'num_games_owned': 3259, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1457487160}
review:
Nice graphics. Decent gameplay. Mediocre plot. I accidently trapped myself twice by jumping into an area that I assume was supposed to be inaccesible.

Mostly puzzle based platforming until the last level and then it switches to skill based. The game feels like a long tutorial especially since it took only about 2 hours to finish.

Main reason I wrote this review is to point out how horrible the protaganist is. He is mean to the snail constantly even though the snail saves his life multiple times. Also, to progress at one point I was forced to cripple a child for life in order to steal his cane as an adult in order to grab a hook that was out of reach. The old guy I steal it from even has his entire life perspective changed as a result. Before breaking the kid's leg, his adult self was grateful for the home and his life. After, he blamed the house for a miserable life. I actually tried to find an alternate solution because I felt so terrible.

TLDR: Pretty, short, and I didnt understand the moral of the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025267880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1455505039}
review:
This is a cute little game with a cute little mechanic of manipulating time. It's a puzzle-platformer where you can go back and forth in time to two periods, one before a disaster and one after. You have a friendly snail companion to help you jump to otherwise unreachable locations.The story is minimal, but decent. Think a slimmed down version of Bastion's story with an extremely rudimentary version of Braid and that's Chronology.

Pros:
+Decent story
+Good music
+Interesting mechanic

Neutral:
~ Okay art
~ Voice acting wasn't fantastic
~ Snail companion was too cute to give the story any weight. I get the tie in with time and snails (ha ha) but it's just...too cute.

Cons:
-Extremely short. I spent 2 hours and there were several times when I wasted a good 5-10 minutes wandering around trying to figure out a couple of puzzles because they weren't obvious. I could have done with more over everything: more puzzles, more story, more anything.

Overall: 8/10. Nothing fantastic, but different enough to be enjoyable. Don't buy at full price, even though it's cheap to begin with. Worth the $3 I paid for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2476, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 668, 'last_played': 1455405379}
review:
Chronology Ã© mais um game do estilo plataforma, mas ele tambÃ©m Ã© Ãºnico, mesmo tendo uma estÃ³ria simples a ambientaÃ§Ã£o do jogo e a mecÃ¢nica de viagem no tempo acabam o tornando especial, a arte tambÃ©m Ã© bela e os puzzles Ãºnicos. O Ãºnico real defeito que posso apontar neste jogo Ã© a duraÃ§Ã£o, acho que terminei com 4 horas na primeira vez, isso enrolando um pouco. Vale a pena, principalmente em promoÃ§Ã£o.

Chronology is another platform game, but it is also unique, even though a simple story the setting of the game and the time trip mechanics end up making it special, art is also beautiful and puzzles unique. The only real fault I can point is the length, I think I finished with 4 hours the first time, thats lingering a little. Worth it, especially on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025779198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1455041128}
review:
Chronology es un videojuego en 2D que mezcla plataformas y puzles. Nos pone en la piel de un inventor que viaja al pasado para evitar que una tragedia destroce su ciudad. Los cambios entre el pasado y el presente se ejecutan tan solo pulsando un botÃ³n y modificar el pasado, para que esos cambios alteren el presente es la base principal de los puzles que plantea.

Pros:
- Los puzles y sus mecÃ¡nicas, muy interesantes.
- El apartado visual estÃ¡ muy logrado.

Contras:
- Demasiado corto y no ofrece nada para rejugarlo.
- El control es algo tosco.

ConclusiÃ³n: Chronology es un buen juego de puzles que peca sobretodo en su duraciÃ³n. Si ofreciera logros o algo que lo hiciese rejugable aun se podrÃ­a perdonar, pero sin nada de ello su duraciÃ³n es demasiado escasa. Para los que no os importe su duraciÃ³n os lo recomiendo, pues sus mecÃ¡nicas son interesantes. Para los que dos horas se os hagan demasiado cortas solo lo podrÃ­a recomendar estando en oferta.

PuntuaciÃ³n: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042838346', 'num_games_owned': 5512, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1498252843}
review:
Chronology est un court puzzle-platformer dans lequel vous devrez manipuler le temps afin de sauver le prÃ©sent.

Vous incarnez un vieil inventeur qui veut tenter d'empÃªcher la destruction du monde survenue aprÃ¨s l'invention d'une machine trÃ¨s puissante.

Le gameplay est simple : vous vous servez d'une montre spÃ©ciale afin de jongler entre le passÃ© d'avant la catastrophe et le prÃ©sent dÃ©solÃ©. Cette mÃ©canique de jeu vous permettra de faire apparaitre des plateformes comme des arbres dans le prÃ©sent ou des maisons dans le passÃ©. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=495728020 Lors des premiers chapitres du jeu la progression se fait sans heurts, on avance assez rapidement jusqu'Ã  rencontrer un escargot. Ce dernier offrira de plus grandes possibilitÃ©s de puzzles grÃ¢ce Ã  son pouvoir de figer le temps. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=495728312 Ce pouvoir sera utile pour ralentir des plateformes, passer au travers de certains piÃ¨ges ou encore pour actionner des leviers puis se dÃ©placer sans que le mÃ©canisme ne s'arrÃªte. L'escargot sera aussi indispensable pour effectuer certains sauts puisqu'on pourra se placer sur son dos pour se rapprocher des plateformes. Il pourra aussi boucher des tuyaux crachant de la fumÃ©e ou des effluves toxiques afin de laisser notre inventeur passer etc...

Dans la seconde partie du jeu les puzzles deviennent plus intÃ©ressants, plus exigeants, sans Ãªtre insurmontables. La rÃ©flexion sera au rendez-vous et il faudra jouer avec l'environnement autant qu'avec ses pouvoirs.

ScÃ©naristiquement Chronology ne fait pas preuve de beaucoup d'originalitÃ©, il faudra simplement sauver le monde en arrÃªtant un savant fou. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=495728113 On aura droit Ã  quelques cinÃ©matiques dessinÃ©es Ã  la main entre chaque niveaux, apprÃ©ciables mais elles ne laissent pas un souvenir impÃ©rissable.

Les graphismes du jeu sont jolis, ses couleurs chatoyantes se rapprochent de celles d'un dessin animÃ© avec des personnages attachants. Les quelques voix qui se feront entendre sont bien doublÃ©es elles-aussi et bien qu'il s'agisse d'un petit jeu on aura droit Ã  des sous-titres franÃ§ais de bonne qualitÃ©.

En bref Chronology est un jeu vraiment sympathique dont l'intÃ©rÃªt rÃ©side principalement dans son gameplay et ses puzzles bien pensÃ©s. Vous auriez bien 2h-2h30 Ã  lui consacrer ?

[quote]Lisez d'autres avis sur ma page de curation : [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/9002662/]Kitsune's Guide[/url][/b][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561197961349980', 'num_games_owned': 750, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1426360742}
review:
I really liked the way how puzzles were made but this game was way too short. It felt like playing a demo or beta version because it only took about 2h to finish and I wasn't even rushing it through.

[b]Plusplus:[/b]

+ Nice graphics
+ Awesome puzzles (and mechanics)

[b]Minusminus:[/b]

- SHORT
- After jumping character freezes for like 1 ms but it's long enough to take away from that smoothiness from gameplay.
- I don't think you were able to skip videos. (not sure about this)
- Absolutely zero replay value if you play in near future.
- Story (At least for me it was super boring.)


I had really hard time to decide should I recommend this but I guess I'm just gonna do it because I really liked those puzzles and mechanics they were build upon and that weights a lot in these kinds of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966720521', 'num_games_owned': 3409, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1427055242}
review:
Un plataformas en 2d cuyo aspecto jugable se centra en la manipulaciÃ³n del tiempo, alterando elementos del pasado, el futuro, o incluso deteniendo el propio tiempo segÃºn nos convenga. Me sorprendiÃ³ la originalidad de este sistema, aunque seguramente se podrÃ­a y me habrÃ­a gustado que se explotara aÃºn mÃ¡s con mÃ¡s niveles, ya que la duraciÃ³n actual es de poco mÃ¡s de 2-3 horas.

No obstante me ha gustado mucho todo el diseÃ±o artÃ­stico, y la historia aÃºn siendo breve es bastante acorde con el resto de cosas. En general los puzzles no son complicados, siempre y cuando no olvides las habilidades que se te proporcionan para resolverlos.

Solo encontrÃ© algÃºn fallo visual menor sin gran importancia.

Si estÃ¡s saturado de experiencias que ofrecen infinitas horas de duraciÃ³n y buscas algo relativamente sencillo, corto, a la vez que entretenido, este juego puede ajustarse muy bien a ello. Su precio base es decente para lo que ofrece, y si ademÃ¡s lo encuentras de oferta ni me lo pensarÃ­a.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998640886', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1426331406}

review: SÃ³ compre se for 75% off por ai, jogo muito bacana, varios puzzle foda, alguns tem que quebrar a cabeÃ§a mesmo... mais campanha bem pequena entÃ£o por isso nÃ£o vale muito, com 2 horas ~ 3 horas vocÃª completa tudo...  Muito bacana a ideia de tempo passando entre o passado e o futuro, atÃ© mesmo congelando o tempo, jogo feito com amor Ã© outro nivel <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198205216164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1426786884}
review: This game is really neat, I just haven't had the time to getting around to playing it more. I enjoy the element of the time manipulation it definitely felt unique in that aspect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1424986014}
review: Not a bad game, and certainly better than most of the puzzle platformers I've played recently (looking at you Logigun and Gateways). It it super short, only about 2 hours. The art and music are nice. I honestly couldn't tell you what the story was about, as it was pretty bare-bones, not captivating, and didn't make much sense. The voices of the characters are not fitting, especially the snail, which sounds like an 5 year old boy for some reason. There are multiple bugs. Items you have to use get stuck on your snail and you cannot pick them back up, making progressing impossible. This problem is furthered by the fact that there are no save points, if you quit the level you have to do the entire thing over. Luckily levels arent that long. Another big is sometimes things that should be interactable aren't, leaving you to spend some time switching time and hoping that it fixes itself. The other biggest problem is with puzzles. While many are cool and intuitive and make nice use of mechanics, some make no sense. Most of the time it's because you didn't know that object that looked to be part of the background was interactable. In one instance you're supposed to know that a light in the background can be jumped next to and that causes it to be knocked down, even though that's never happened before in the game, and there are other similar looking lights in the room but one is just usable for no reason. Usually when I looked up solutions I thought "well how was I supposed to know I could use that, or that it would do that to that object, that has never happened earlier in the game and that's not reall reasonable", or "that looks like the background". Also the platforming isn't that great, as your guy moves super slowly and jumping feels like he has lead weights tied around both ankles. Most of the jumps you have to make take multiple tries and you may just BARELY make one time even though you were standing on the very end of the ledge, and you just barely landed only half way on the other ledge. All in all its a cute fun little game. Wish the puzzles made more sense or were more obvious that what you had to do was even an option. 6.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039667295', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1424619531}
review:
Chronology Ã© um dos jogos mais meigos que jÃ¡ joguei.

Simples, divertido e com um charme prÃ³prio, o jogo continua divertido do comeÃ§o ao fim.

O Ãºnico problema Ã© que Ã© muito curto, mas esse problema Ã© definitivamente ignorado por seu preÃ§o baixo, possuindo assim um custo/benefÃ­cio maravilhoso.

Pra quem gostou de Braid e Limbo e Ã© apaixonado por indie games, Chronology Ã© altamente indicado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981557797', 'num_games_owned': 5234, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1424140212}
review: Although really brief, this was a surprisingly well done puzzle platformer.  It only takes about 90 minutes to play through; but the hand-drawn looking art style and time mechanic really make things interesting.  I did find the snails voice to be somewhat irritating; but thankfully she didn't talk too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078143581', 'num_games_owned': 3295, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1421954688}
review:
Chronology es un juego encantador. Sus personajes, su estÃ©tica, su historia, su banda sonora, su sentido del humorâ€¦ todo ayuda a conseguir el magnÃ­fico clima donde se desarrolla la aventura. A lo largo de sus ocho capÃ­tulos iremos con el inventor y su amigo caracol avanzando a travÃ©s de bosques y ciudades, manejando los distintos escenarios en dos realidades diferentes: el horrible presente y el esperanzador pasado. Gracias a Ã©sta habilidad podremos acceder a aquellos lugares que parecen inaccesibles, cambiar el aspecto de un escenario o incluso el comportamiento de un personaje secundario.

Como dicen otros analistas, se trata de un juego corto (a mi me ha durado unas tres horas, pero se puede hacer en menos). Es un juego muy sencillo en tÃ©rminos generales; ademÃ¡s, la acciÃ³n pausada permite al jugador deleitarse con los escenarios y las interacciones de los personajes.

El Ãºnico fallo que le veo es la existencia de dos o tres bugs (no encontrÃ© mÃ¡s) que, en el peor de los casos, te obligan a reiniciar el nivel. No es un gran problema porque son niveles cortos y, una vez descubierto como avanzar, se hace rÃ¡pido. Pero sÃ­ es un poco molesto. Sin embargo, se trata de un pequeÃ±o pecado que se le perdona con gusto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048092359', 'num_games_owned': 1702, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1421242984}
review:
Chronology is a short puzzle platformer with an emphasis on short and puzzle. At times it feels more like a point and click adventure than a platformer, in fact the only time i got stuck in the game was in one of the "point and clicky parts" with the  toothache plant. Despite getting stuck for 20 minutes I finished the game in just a little over an hour.

The controls are fine, although they could be improved. In some of the puzzles you have to switch between the characters and use their special time manipulating abilites, it would be nice if you could control the snail and the inventor at the same time or at least use 2 different buttons for their abilites.

The story is told as you solve the puzzles and is really straightforward, the game seems suitable for children.

Overall it was a short but nice little experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086290545', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1421340292}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004406947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1421160841}
review:
Chronology is a platform game that grants you the ability to manipulate time. Its worthy of being purchased by all fans of puzzle games. You start adventuring as an old man and are soon joined by a young snail. You will need to switch between those both characters with different abilities. The old man can change time to future and present, the snail can stop time. You can take different items to combine them in different times. The Puzzles arent really complicated.

Now the negative about it: I guess the game isnt tested very well because it happens that i take steps which werent meant to be like this on one part it was impossible to continue the game with what i did. Sometimes it didnt trigger the events and i was running around for long times till i looked up a walkthrough and figured out that the game is just not working. One Part in Chapter 6..i couldnt pick up the flower anymore to give it to the old Lady. It needed 2 chapter restarts till it finally worked. Another Part was by fixing the saw..it didnt combine the 2 Parts..so another Chapter restart. Next Part in Chapter 7 i jump up to the Hook and it wont fall down after around 50 Jumps and restarting the chapter and replay everything i gave up..till im on another computer and see how it is working there. And Blackscreens by some videos sequences.

Still i recommend this game it has nice mechanics and a good idea. The Price is worth it.
